See what else the market has to offer.
Go back through the portal, figure things out.
Split up and decide to meet back here.
1.content:
Thus she was back home in the states before she got to try to sate her excitement. She hadn't even unpacked before she locked herself in her room and opened the book, that's when it hit her how tough the language really was, this Old English was no joke and the handwriting didn't exactly help, so she called Mandy over and from her got that Amy was back from Salem as well.
Turned out that Salem was more of a tourist attraction than the place to find the real deal, they did have a few well dressed enthusiasts though, but that was about it.

The three of them thus started transcribing the book that very night. Bethany flipping the pages and Amy trying to help her make out the handwriting, while Mandy wrote it down on the computer. Even if they didn't get every word and thought the grammar was funky they had no trouble determining that this book contained some freaky shit.

Two days later Bethany had still not unpacked and the three of them had gathered in the school library, not that the school had started or anything, but they needed help translating some of the words and there were old English dictionaries here, not to be borrowed though, which sort of forced them to come here.

Together they managed to figure out that the beginning of the book was some kind of ritual, it looked interesting enough and a lot of the ingredients and items that would have been hard to come by back in the day were nothing hard to come by this day and age. So they figured why not try it out?
Thus when they found something required they made note of it and once they had translated the whole ritual and come to the conclusion that it was supposed it unlock their witches' powers they were eager to try it out. What if it would work?

Most of the things they could get at the supermarket and the trickier things the local New Age hippie could help them with.
That just left engraving various symbols on the items required, it turned out Mandy was the most artistic of them, but she refused to do all three of the wooden sticks required, since there was to be one for each participant and judging by the book and the one Mandy had started on they looked pretty much like wands, so she was probably right, a witch should make her own wand and so they did.

That left them with; Where to perform the ritual?
They would need to be able to set it up in privacy and from the looks of it, it might take a couple of hours to perform.
In the end they settled for Amy's walk in closet, it was larger than the other two's put together, so after removing and rearranging most of the stuff in it they had still not a lot of room, but enough they figured.

Mandy being the one with most skill with the brush painted the various symbols and circles on the floor while Beth handled the burning of various substances and Amy led the whole thing and did the somewhat quiet chanting so that they wouldn't be overheard.
Luckily Mandy had remembered to make sure all fire alarms on the floor were disabled before they started because it was quite smoky inside the closet by the time the ritual was over and the girls waited for something to happen.

The smoke didn't feel like fire smoke though, but it smelled and looked the part. Strangely it seemed to thicken and slowly concentrate to within the circles on the floor, then they all gasped as the outer circle started to shimmer slightly then the next and the next and then all the symbols started shimmering as well and then the smoke it self, that by now looked like a solid black arch, brightened until it shone in a dark blue light.
Looking down they saw that all the items they had placed out around the circles were gone except for their three wands, Amy managed to see the last of the hippie crystals melt away and flow like ink into the weave of circles and symbols and then their wands jerked and the engraved symbols they had carved into them shone for a few seconds before the wands went dull and still again. Now nothing seemed to change, the Arch inside the circles remained vaguely shimmering but nothing more. Mandy reached out and touched it, but her hand just went straight through, nothing seemed to happen.

Bethany picked up her wand and waved it at the portal with no more result, so she poked it with her wand and as the tip hit the blue surface the point of impact shone bright blue, like a summer sky.

“Take your wands girls.” She grinned and stepped towards the arch, and unlike Mandy's arm that had just gone through it, she seemed to go into it in a flash of light and be gone.

The two girls remaining watched nervously at each other and then at the dark blue shape in front of them. They took their wands in one hand and the other one's hand in the other, then with a nod they too walked into the arch and found themselves in a market stall selling cheap dresses of questionable quality. They saw Bethany waiting for them with a grin and behind them an, as far as they could tell, identical portal to the one they gone through in Amy's walk in closet, half inside the stall and half outside it, the tent fabric wall flopping through it without any noticeable impact.

Outside the stall they could see a busy makeshift street packed on both sides with stalls and over head a bright blue summer sky with the sun riding high. It seemed that they had jumped straight into a market, people appeared to be dressed oddly enough, but there wasn't really a general style, nor a common nationality as far as they could tell.

“What's that?” Amy wondered and pointed towards a man that looked like your normal helium balloon market vendor, but it would seem he wasn't selling balloons, but flying pigs of various sizes.

“I guess that explains what the ritual meant by 'opening the door to the realm of possibility'.” Bethany said with a huge grin on her face. “We did get our door, right?”
1.title: The Realm of Possibility.

11.content:
Mandy hurries towards the pig salesman, leaving her two friends behind, getting a bit of a head start before they figure to follow her.

On her way over she sees a young woman dressed in loose soft fabrics, most of them red, matching the hair, it kind of reminds her of something pirate-ish or harem, the lighter top ends below her chest and the open vest that covers it doesn't reach down any further and its sleeves end at the elbows, it's mostly the pants that gives the loose feeling, tied with a cord onto her hip so that the hipbones poke out at the edges, the soft fabric then falls onto her athletic frame from there, making a bit of a bag appearance as they are tied in below her knees where they also end.

What makes Mandy notice and pay attention to the girl is that she walks up to the pig vendor and purchases a small pig, somewhat larger than her head. She doesn't look too happy, perhaps the price was steep, but then as she walks away Mandy almost stumble over her own feet as she watches the girl shove the whole pig into her mouth and then slurp the string in like a piece of spaghetti.

By then she has made her way to the vendor, so with a couple of quick steps she manages to catch up with the girl and puts a hand on her shoulder to get her attention.

“Excuse me miss, could I listen to your tummy to see if I could hear the pig squeal in there?” Mandy asks noticing that despite the relatively large pig that just went into it, the girls trim belly is completely flat, not counting abdominals.

“Sure, my pleasure.” The girl answers and her expression changes from surprised and bothered to giddy. Then Mandy find the girl's hands on her upper arms and the next moment she finds that the girl isn't just surprisingly strong, she also finds out what the piglet went through just seconds earlier, as the girl's mouth opens impossibly wide and before she manages to protest she's looking down the dark tunnel of the girl's throat. Lips closing around her shoulders and a greedy swallow dragging her into her waist, a second one quickly follows, pulling in her hips and rump and a third one along with gravity and suction from the girl sends the rest of Mandy down into the girl's stomach.

Mandy's friends had overheard the conversation and watched on, while they tried to make their way over in time, as their friend got eaten, but before they managed to even get her attention Mandy was simply gone, making no more imprint in the girl's frame than the piglet had and the girl being unaware of them resumed her stroll.
With the girl obviously being a lot stronger than what one would expect of a girl the two students following her had quite a difficult task catching up to her as she navigated the throng of people crowding the streets while the two in pursuit were held up at every turn.
After a few minutes though Beth managed to reach out and grasp the girl's arm, something that made the girl turn and give her a very annoyed look.
“What?!”

“Mandy just wanted to listen to your stomach, not be inside it.”

“Huh?”

“You know put her ear against it and listen.”

“Oh... She should have phrased herself better then.”

“So can you please throw her up then?”

“Kind of hard, she'd need to be in my stomach for that.” She girl said pointing to just below her left pert breast. “But she's about here now.” She added pointing to her belly well below her belly button.

“You digested her that quickly?!” Beth said shocked.

“Yeah, I was pretty hungry, but I could only afford a little piglet, so I didn't question my luck when your friend offered herself to me.”

Beth and Amy just stared dumbstruck, they struggled to grasp the fact that this girl had just eaten Mandy like a cookie and digested her like cotton candy.

“I guess we'll need to find a toilet then, I assume you want her back.” The girl continued, taking little notice of the girls' states.

“But she'll just be your poop...” Beth said realising that she was thankful the girl turned out to be fairly friendly seeing as she could have easily sent her and Amy to join Mandy as parts of her next bowel movement.
“Of course, so you'll need to find a good healer, you don't want a quack, unless you want her brought back half pig, half girl, or just get the piglet back, seeing as she's well mixed with that piglet I ate just before her.”

“Oh...” Amy and Beth managed as they realised that other impossible things were possible here, not just flying pigs and literal maneaters, but resurrection as well.

“Hmm...I almost forgot we'll need a container as well...” The girl said brooding for all of two seconds. “I think there's a vendor selling jars over here she said and grasped Beth's arm dragging the girl through the crowd.”

It wasn't far, but once there Beth could see that there were no large jars on the table, only various relatively small ones ranging from simple plain ones without lids to exceedingly elaborate ones.
“Won't we need a bigger container?” She wondered.

“No, just one to fit the solid waste, the rest is just water and not essential.” The girl assured.

“Oh, so what currency to you use here, I've only got dollars.”

“Dollars?” The girl looked like she'd never heard of it. “Pure metal coins, or just the metals themselves, so gold, silver and copper is typically it, unless you want to trade items and haggle. Tell you what, since it was a misunderstanding, I'll pay for the jar.” The girl said and scrutinized the available containers and their prices. Beth noticing that the girl studied the plain and obviously cheaper ones, she even picked up a couple and looked inside, before putting it back. Then she placed a hand on her belly and closed her eyes, brows frowning in concentration.

“What are you doing?”

“Just making sure she's properly digested.” The girl said and resumed what she was doing.
A couple of minutes later she stopped and prodded her lower belly then picked up a plain clay jar far smaller than the ones she'd looked at earlier and looked inside it, then called the vendor, before exchanging a few coins with him.

Then before Beth could ask any-more questions she was once again dragged through the streets with Amy struggling to keep up with them falling ever further behind.
Then a couple of turns later the open market stalls gave way to stone walled buildings and at the corner of one of those the girl opened a thick wooden door and dragged Beth inside, had they not scaled a couple of steps in doing so Amy would have lost them.

Inside Beth found herself in what much looked like a public toilet, with lots of stalls that didn't quite offer full privacy, only it looked like a medieval fantasy game version of the same, with stone walls and think wooden doors to the stalls, the wash basins too being in solid stone and instead of faucets a continuous stream of water shot out through a small whole like a miniature waterfall and disappeared down the drain.
While she took it all in the girl had vanished into one of the stalls and soon returned with the small jar, lid now closed and fastened. She handed the jar to Beth before going over to the waterfall to wash her hands.

As the two headed out of there Amy just reached the stairs.

“So where can we find a good healer?”

“Nearly all healers, good and bad can be found by the temples, worshipping one deity or another.” The girl said before she jumped down the stairs and turned to face Beth and Amy one last time. “Give her my thanks, she was very tasty and quite filling.”

With that the girl was lost in the crowd and Amy and Beth were left looking at one another and then looking at the very small jar that contained the remains of their friend, the whole jar was smaller than Beth's fist, it boggled the mind that the girl had reduced their friend to something that'd fit inside it.
11.title: When pigs fly!

choices: They take the long way round.
111.content:
“Temples huh?” Beth muttered and tried to skim the horizon for any buildings and finding that the stalls of the various vendors were tall enough to block the view of most things not directly above them.

So she scaled the stairs to the toilets again and stood tiptoe there for a couple of seconds before she started jumping up and down instead, getting a glimpse of the edges of the huge market square at the top of each jump.
She saw plain buildings like the stone ones that they had reached at this end and various degrees of more fancy than that leading up to quite grand designs. But what would temples look like? She knew two things, the market was huge, the buildings straight across to the other side were almost lost in the haze rising from the market between her and them and looked tiny from this distance. She also realized that she could only make out parts of the edges of the market, not to mention that the temples didn't necessarily lie around the market at all, that was just what she'd initially assumed.

“Did you see anything?” Amy wondered as Beth stopped jumping. Bethany was the taller of them, so Amy didn't much fancy her chances of seeing anything if Beth hadn't.

“Not much, I think we'll have to ask around. At least I saw a few weird things that we can use for navigational purposes. I also realized that this market might not be the whole of it, what is there's a temple ground somewhere else?”

“Might not be a bad thing.” Amy answered. “The market is crowded and hopefully other streets won't be.”

“True enough.” Beth admitted before turning to a passing man. “Excuse me sir...” She said while managing to get his annoyed attention. “...Could you tell me where to find a temple of healing?”

Frowning he pointed across the market. “Try the Hallowed Hill of the Grove of Regrowth. They are both that way.” Before storming off.

“Thank you.” Beth called after him. “Damn” she added with emphasis.

“What?”

“You've got any idea how big this market is?” Beth asked and Amy shook her head. “And I didn't see any forest or even a hill in that direction. No doubt it's a looong way there. The question is should we trudge through this crowded market, that's probably a mile or more across, or hope that it's easier to go around it and try that instead?
111.title: Find a temple.

1111.content:
With the direction they had gotten being anything but precise they figured that they should just make it across to the other side before asking for more specific directions.
Luckily they found that the dense crowd they had been stuck in was only an occasional occurrence, most of the time there were still quite a bit of people but one could easily flow with the tide one way or the other.
And at times when things stood still they could pass the time by paying more attention to the stalls around them. The market in many ways resembled that of your normal town square market, during some festival or other, with the difference of the variety of the wares. The obligatory toy weapons were there, but the range went all the way to real ones as well. Same thing with the obligatory vegetables and fruits ranging all the way to finished products and living animals, and many of varieties neither girl had seen before. Wicker baskets were there and so were top notch backpacks and what for the life of them they assumed were at least supposed to be magical bags and boxes, judging from their intricate décor.
As they walked along plain plastic bracelets of florescent colours made way for ones made of noble metals engraved with works of art and then back again. Likewise every type of garment seemed to be available at one stall or another from funny hats to fancy hats, from underwear to overcoats and from t-shirts to formal wear.

While they trudged along at times they could hear crowds cheering or gasping in awe, or even booing at times, though the former two seemed to be more common, so clearly there were market performers, games and shows as well, though luckily none in their path. Only browsers and hagglers and content customers seemed to occupy the makeshift streets they choose as they zigzagged across the mostly cobbled ground towards the other side of the market, a track that took them over an hour.

After all that time it felt pretty weird to see the market-stalls give way to conventional buildings, these ones in stone as well like the ones they had left an hour ago, though these ones looked a bit more elaborate. And down the streets between then the throng of people thinned out significantly, so they continued down to a crossroad before stopping to ask anyone, quite eager to get away form the stifling heat of the market, not to mention the deafening choir of voices from the people there and some of their wares.

As they stood there enjoying the slight breeze blowing down one of the streets of the crossing an older man who'd also left the market came down the same way they had moments ago and approached their position, pulling a one-wheeled contraption behind him that seemed to house his purchased wares.

“Excuse me sir...” Amy started.

“I'm no sir.” The man objected.

“Well, pardon me then, me and my friend were wondering where we could find a good healer.”

“Oh, well. The druids of the Grove are down that way.” He said pointing down one of the roads. “They are at the edge of the city. Good healers amongst them, but they are not the most sociable lot. Don't count on them helping you.”

“Oh, but we heard of some Hallowed Hill, would our chances be better there?”

“Sure enough, plenty of healers there as well and more forthcoming, no doubt, just be wary of the quacks who seem to crowd the place.”

“We'll keep that in mind, so where can we find it, if you don't mind telling us?” Beth joined in.

“It's over there.” The man said pointing with his whole arm. “Just walk down this street and eventually you should be able to spot the temple of Hela's copper roof bristling in the sunlight between the houses as it lies atop the hill.”

“Aren't copper roofs green?” Amy wondered.

“Usually yes, but this is a temple of healing we're talking about, so it's not the place for decay.” The man smiled.

“Thank you very much.” Both girls said and turned to one another as the man went on his merry way.

Where were they to go?
1111.title: Crossing the market.

choices: They aim for the temple itself.
They head for the hill in search of someone that looks like the real deal doctor
11111.content:
The old gentleman had told it true, soon enough they could spot the shimmering roof of the temple in the distance, though blocked out of view more often than not by buildings or growth close to them. The hill obviously weren't that high, but still fairly distinct.

And as they approached their destination they noticed how the people in the street changed from normal to either religious variants, or either sickly or injured. With the odd one looking fairly normal amongst them standing out from the rest.

“Seems we're heading for the right place.” Amy said.

“Yeah, but none look as bad as Mandy. She said and held up the clay jar.”

“Hmm...About that, we haven't looked inside. What if it's empty?”

“Yeah, it does look a bit small...though the girl seemed too helpful to trick us like that.”

“Better make sure right?” Amy said and fiddled for her cellphone.

“I suppose we'd look really silly showing up with an empty jar, even if the kind of healing we're looking for still seems quite far fetched.” Beth agreed and worked open the lid to have a look inside.

To both the girls surprise there was a brown lump in it, but it was too small to call a turd, being only somewhat larger than a golf-ball.
Then Amy surprised Beth by producing her phone and taking a couple of pictures of the jar and its contents.

“What did you do that for?”

“I figured that if this works Mandy would like a picture of herself.” Amy said realising that if it didn't work out that this would be the last pictures of her friend. “A shame I forgot to take pictures of the girl that did this to her.” She added, she'd hardly gotten a good look at the girl herself, having been to busy chasing her.
“Al-right” Beth nodded looking down at the remains of Mandy one last time. The smell wasn't that potent, but still there and distinct for the type of material it consisted of, so Beth put the lid back on and made sure to fasten it properly. “Let's hope this works.” She said and started walking towards the hill again.

And it was soon apparent what the people had said about the quacks around the place, many were quite blatant, while others were smooth talkers selling potions and whatnot and some again horribly convincing, but they weren't even at the foot of the hill yet, so the girls figured that they should continue on.
11111.title: The Hallowed Hill.

111111.content:
Since the girls look neither sickly, nor injured the various healers and do gooders leave them alone, unaware of what the girls are looking for. Hence it's quite the easy track through the crowd of wailing people to the top of the hill.

They were a bit surprised to see the temple surrounded by a white stone wall and the gates under guard. In Shining white robes and curiass, helmet and halberd the same colour as the roof two guards step forward to block their path.

“Halt!” The two middle-aged men call out in unison.

The girls do as commanded. And Beth noticing that beyond the gates hardly anyone walks the temple grounds, a stark contrast to the sickly crowd outside. “We're seeing the aid of the healers of Hela.” Beth says remembering the name the old man had used.

“You do not look neither sickly nor injured.” One of the guards state, looking them over.

“It's our friend that needs help and we come here in her name.” Beth continued.

“Be that as it may.” The guard said and looked the two girls over, they looked quite fresh and clean unlike the crowd behind them, a bit sweaty from their journey here, but no more than the guards were from standing in the sun for a few hours, he couldn't dismiss them on those grounds. “Search them.” He ordered the other guard who put his halberd aside and proceeded to frisk the girls, much to their displeasure as he didn't leave any part of their body unchecked. Then proceeded to check the contents of their purses, making both girls worry about their keys, which looked for all the world like wands, engraved in cryptic runes and all. But the guard didn't seem to care about those, though he paid a few other things more attention like their house keys and Amy's tiny can of hairspray.

He didn't object to any of the contents though and put it all back before giving them an all clear and going back to his halberd and his post. A nod to the other guard was all that followed and the two stepped aside to let the girls pass.

A bit bewildered the girls wearily pass the guards and enter the open expanse in front of the temple. Seeing as the clergy should be inside they ignore the people walking about the temple grounds and head up the wide, but not overly tall stairs that end in a second man-made level upon which the actual temple is built. A second much smaller but richly ornamented stair leads to the open brazen gates of the temple that could compete with any cathedral, except for in height as it stands only a a handful stories tall, barely cresting the tallest trees on the temple grounds.

As they walk inside they find a great hall with ivory pillars sprouting like a forest upwards and supporting a richly painted roof far above. Paintings hard to discern in the gloom. The pale white figures that smoothly flow across the floor in one way or another are more easy to make out. They aren't many but they seem to be well in majority. The girls had expected to find more people in here if this was a place of healing considering the vast hoard of people in need outside the gates.

Clearly the the white robed people are the followers of the deity in question, monks and nuns both seem wrong as there seem to be both sexes and the way their uniforms hug their figures clashes with the concept of celibacy one typically associate with the inhabitants of a cloister.

They walk further into the temple, slowly approaching the middle of this great hall, observing the coming and goings of the white figures, noticing amongst other things that they all appear young, no one looks to be older than thirty.

They did come here with a task though, so whom should they approach with the subject?
111111.title: The Temple.

choices: Ask for something for Mandy to cover herself with.
1111111.content:
“Excuse me sir?” Beth says as she steps in front of a passing male in tight white robes. Not a hard thing as none of them seems to be in any hurry.

“Can I help you miss?” The man wonders, looking puzzled, possibly why she chose to approach him.

“We were told this was the place to find a healer.” Amy continued as she stepped up next to her friend.

“Indeed, what kind of healing is required? All the followers of Hela are familiar with the arts of her gifts, but some are more so than others.” He inquired.

“Great healing.” Beth said, seeing his face change quite drastically.

“Oh...” He said and motioned for the girls to follow him. “In that case I think you seek one of the Daughters of Hela.” He started walking towards the back of the great hall. “Follow me and say nothing unless spoken to.”

The girls fell silently in behind him and followed him through a door in the back into a series of corridors and up a couple of stairs only to once more head down a hallway before he turned around to face them.

“Stay here.”

They did as told and watched him gently slide across the red carpeted floor towards a large wooden door that looked more brazen art than wood. There he stopped and gently placed his hands on either of the two halves of the large door. He didn't knock or say anything, he just stood there for a minute or so. Then softly, yet suddenly, the door swung open and in the portal stood a majestic woman towering at least a head over then man, who immediately fell to his knees, revealing more of the woman, who seemed as young as the rest of the white robed people they had seen, but her robes seemed to be stitched together in tasteful manners and decorated by brilliant copper threads, likewise her hair was hard placed in colour and decorated by items in such a way that it looked to be all made of their metal of choice, gleaming copper.

A soft murmur passing between them was all the girls could distinguish before the man still kneeling slid backwards, got to his feet, bowed and disappeared down a sideway. The woman then stepped through the doorway into the hall and the doors closed on their own behind her. She motioned for the girls to follow her and then started her smooth walk down the opposite direction the man had went.

She didn't go far, with a smooth motion she opened a more normal sized door, though still tall enough that she had no trouble walking through it. As they caught up they found the door remained open while they entered, but closed on its own once they were inside. By then the woman had already seated herself in a plain yet both comfortable and expensive looking recliner.
A couple of meters in front of her lay a series of large pillows in a half circle and she motioned for the girls to take a seat.

“So young Brodas told me you came seeking the help of a great healer. Tell me about it.” The woman said in a soft sultry voice that carried.

“Our friend got eaten and digested in the market and we were told a good healer could help her.” Beth answered.

“Ahh... well that might be so. Show me what remains.” The woman said. And Beth fiddled with her purse, bringing the small jar out, but before she could get up to hand the jar to the woman the jar floated out of her hand and sailed through the air, landing softly between the Daughter's fingers. Likewise the lid came undone and removed itself on its own.

“Was this friend of yours some pet creature of yours?” The woman queried

“No, she's a girl just like us, but the one that ate her had just eaten a flying piglet.” Beth answered dutifully.

“I see, then this predator did quite a number on your friend.” The woman smirked, while the clay jar resealed itself.
“How do yo intend to pay for the service?” The woman continued. An aspect the girls hadn't considered.

“Well, we hadn't thought about that part...” Amy stumbled. “...I've got a golden necklace...” She continued. “It's only eighteen carat, but twenty four is too soft for most jewellery.” She said defensibly as she reached behind her neck to unclasp it, she'd gotten it for her birthday from a former boyfriend, so she didn't mind that much to part with it.

“That's good, but not enough.” The woman continued.

“I've got earrings that go with it.” Amy continued.

Seeing as that didn't look like enough Beth reluctantly joined in “I've got silver earrings and my gold engagement-ring.”

“And I don't think Mandy's gold belly piercing should be digested either, I doubt she minds parting with it, if you don't mind where it has been.” Amy continued.

The woman had trouble not giggling at that, so with a somewhat warmer smile she agreed “Okay, that will have to do.” As she rose so did the mentioned jewellery as well. The lid of the jar only opening enough to let the small rod out. All of it floated to the woman's face before dropping into a bowl next to her chair that neither of the girls had noticed before.

Walking over to an alter at the end of the room and stepping behind it, the girls turned and watched as the woman put the jar down in its center and the lid opened on its own once more.
Raising her hands the air crackled and heat pulsed from her location, then the air seemed to go dry while a mist formed around the priestess.
That mist swirled around her and she seemed to manipulate it with her hands, slowly it condensed and as it did a darkness crept up and out of the jar and filled the mist, which then brightened until the girls had to shield their eyes. When they looked back Mandy was there kneeling naked on the altar looking like a child in front of the Daughter.

The daughter didn't touch Mandy, but they could still see that it was her doing as their friend floated off the table over to them and landed on her feet before them.

“Please leave.” The Daughter commanded. And at the same time Mandy seemed to wake up and finding out that she was naked. Her two friends rose up and reached an arm around her each as they led her out of the room while Mandy tried as best she could to cover herself.
1111111.title: Male Acolyte.

choices: They try and find a solution to Mandy's nakedness.
They leave with Mandy still naked.
11111111.content:
The man that had helped them, Brodas was it? Hadn’t seemed like he thought even slightly irritating the Daughter was a good idea, so Amy and Bethany lead Mandy down the stairs and out of the temple as quickly as they can, much to Mandy's puzzlement and as such they at times have to shove or drag her along.

It's not until they are outside the temple doors overseeing the nigh empty temple grounds that they pause and hug their friend.
“We thought we had lost you?” Amy says, burrowing her face in-between Mandy's naked breasts, to the girl's embarrassment and surprise.

“Lost me? And why am I naked?” She asks shoving Amy away form her tits. “What happened?”

“You don't remember?” Amy asks?

“Remember what?”

“A redhead that swallowed a pig?” Bethany says.

“Yeah...Oh...so...” Mandy recalls.

“Amy, show her.” Bethany says while Amy fishes out her phone.

After a few seconds she's found the pictures. “Here...” she says handing the phone to Mandy.

“That's me?” Mandy asks looking at the picture.

“And the pig.” Amy adds.

Beth notices that her bag is open and when she moves to close it she sees that the clay jar is in it. “And this is the jar.” She says fishing it out and handing it to Mandy.

“Oh...” Mandy says as she accepts the jar before handing the phone back to Amy. “And that's mister piggy, I assume?” She adds as she opens the jar to have a look and finds a bit of brown stuff still in it, so she closes it again.

“I would assume so.” Bethany says accepting the jar back without having a look herself, more wondering if she should keep it at all or not, but then seeing as she can't discard it here she makes sure the lid is on properly and then puts it back in her handbag.
11111111.title: Leaving.

111111111.content:
A good thing with girls, they always seem to carry an unnecessary amount of clothes even when it's too hot for any at all.
Or at least that's what Mandy thought as they tried to find a relatively secluded spot between the temple walls and a couple of pillars a bit away from the entrance.

For both her friends had had on two tops one sleeveless and one shorter with sleeves. They both give their sleeved short tops to Mandy and after some convincing Beth wiggles out of her pants and hand Mandy her panties as well before putting the pants on commando style.

Mandy isn't too fond of accepting someone's used underwear but puts them on inside out while she wears Bethany's top on normally and ties Amy's larger top around her hips like a skirt of sorts. At least with the panties on she doesn't actually show anything.

Thus dressed they leave the temple.
The guards recognise two of them seeing as it's the same guards and not that many have passed by as of late. They do lift an eyebrow each, but doesn't say anything and the girls pass by unhindered.

Outside Mandy is faced with the less than pleasant crowd, that her two friends have already made their way through once. They know it ends and where too, so they head back the way they had come earlier until the sickly and grotesque are out of sight.

“I guess not everyone gets help huh?” Mandy says when they are through. “How did you do it?”

“Gold.” Was Amy's answer.

“That seems to be the currency here, noble metals. We gave the priestess that healed you all we had, including your belly piercing.” Bethany explained.

“Oh...” Mandy said and looked at Bethany's hand.

“Yeah, that too.”

“Sorry...”

“Not your fault really, seriously, how were you to know that that girl would freaking eat you?”

“Heh, guess not, at any rate I don't recommend it. Getting digested is pretty painful, luckily she did it quickly.” Mandy said trying to joke it away. “I suppose we should be a bit careful in the future. And frankly I wouldn't mind heading back for some real clothes at least. Can I even get back? I mean that girl digested my wand too, which I assume was the key for the door.”

“I think so” Amy said. “I mean we could bring our clothes and stuff with us, so why not a person?” Then she added with a grin “and if holding my hand won't do the trick I hear you are pretty delicious, so I wouldn't be against offering a ride.” Amy said rubbing her belly.

“Haaaa... Not that funny.” Mandy replied but couldn't help watching Amy's tummy while it was getting rubbed.

“The girl told us to give you her thanks and tell you that you were tasty and pretty filling.” Bethany said, explaining the reference.

“I wonder...was I?”

“Tasty, probably, but filling? Considering you didn't make the slightest dent in her belly and the huge amount of waste you became, I'd say, not really.” Bethany continued.

“So can we go home now?” Mandy reiterated.

“It's a looong way back to the portal.” Amy said. “It's on the other side of the market and it is biiig.”

“Oh, so where are we going?”
111111111.title: Makeshift clothes.

choices: She's convinced there are better up ahead.
She wants to buy one of them anyhow.
1111111111.content:
“I suppose we should return to the market seeing as eventually we should go back anyhow.” Amy said.

“Yeah, we might find clothes for you along the way, they sell all kinds of stuff, question is if we've got anything they are willing to trade for?” Bethany added before they headed up towards the market. Amy had first stared down the way they had come earlier, but the market was just up ahead over here and this way they'd not cover the same part of it, not that they had browsed much on their way to the temple, but still.

They didn't get far before Mandy saw what they meant about the market having everything and apparently in no real order. The fruit-stand was next to the longsword vendor, who in turn was next to the funny ball-cap salesman.

Mandy was keeping her eyes out for some clothes, a skirt, or a pair of pants would be nice, while her two friends were looking more or less at everything, trying to see something interesting, so perhaps it wasn't any wonder that it was they who spotted the person on ridiculously long stilts. They had seen market and carnival stilt walkers before, but these stilts were much longer. She still walked with the same funny fake 'I'm almost losing my balance'-walk that is obligatory of the trade. For as she got closer they could tell that it was a she and she was dressed similarly to the girl that had eaten Mandy, but this one had purple clothes with black stripes going down her legs and her black hair was mostly covered by a huge hat full of black and purple feathers.

Without missing a step she reached down and swapped the hats on the heads of two market goers, who looked about in confusion before trading their hats back to one another.

“How did she do that?” Bethany wondered out loud.

“Seriously? I only hear an unintelligible mumbling, but every time that we talk to someone I swear they are speaking English and you wonder how someone can reach down from a pair of stilts and swap the hats of two people below, that by all rights should be several meters out of reach?” Amy said while she kept her eyes on the performer, who now stood wobbling faking the need to sneeze, only to sneeze out a ball of flame and doing a back-flip over the row of market stalls, landing in another makeshift street and clearly landing on her feet, but a few steps later she was out of sight. “Girl, I think you're trying to bring logic into an equation that just doesn't care for it.” Amy added before she located Mandy and hurried up to her, Mandy having been too occupied with her search to notice the performer, or that her friends had stopped.

Then Mandy finally comes across a market-stand that sells skirts, nothing fancy and certainly nothing she'd consider under normal circumstances, but desperate times...
1111111111.title: Market.

11111111111.content:
“Seriously, what are you doing girl?” Amy says as she grabs Mandy's hand away from one of the awful skirts.

“Getting something to wear.”

“Mandy,” Amy says looking her straight in the eyes. “This market has everything for sale and you reach out for the first cursed item you find? Look at it! I've seen dresses around that princesses would give up their crowns for and you reach for that?”

“For real?”

“Yes, for real. There's everything here and I mean everything, that does include crap like this though and not just the awesome.”

“Hey!” The salesman objects. “Go away you!” He ushers, shooing them off.

As it would turn out though, while the market does have everything, now that they know what they are looking for, they just can't find it. So they wander on and on, even try out different lanes, but no luck. Then they hear people cheering. It is close by, they even make out a person flying though the air occasionally, but it's weird, they can't make out what the people are saying, nor can they see what's really going on regardless of what angle they try. Clearly there's some kind of performance going on, but other than that?
11111111111.title: Wait.

choices: Mandy wants to talk to the girl.
111111111111.content:
They decide to see what this crazy place have to offer, Beth and Amy having the girl on stilts in relatively fresh memory are eager to see more craziness.
Strangely enough they can't see anything between the heads of the other spectators so they have to shove their way to the front before they actually see what's going on, weird since it turns out the circle of spectators was only a few rows thick.

What they see is a fairly familiar sight, well sort of, all three of them recognize the girl, a certain redhead who's pants Mandy has gotten inside at least once so far depending on how you count.

She's juggling, not too strange for a street performer, but only four items which is kind of strange, but more impressive when the items are people, who squeal as they are tossed up into the air again and again, then the girls catches one with her mouth and the person disappears as she continues juggling the remaining three, then the fourth one shoots out of her mouth to join the juggling again and then another person goes into her mouth, and down her throat Mandy notices, who've gone that route before and paid attention this time.

The person shoots back up her throat and into the air and the girl adds the woman in question to her juggled items. The girl repeats this trick a few more times before she changes her juggling arch so that they line up as they descend and then she catches the people one after the other in her mouth and send them to her stomach, which is still flat as she makes her bows.
She receives a nervous applause and stands back up.
The people shoot back up her throat and into the air, she juggles them a couple of rounds before putting them on the ground, sending them staggering to regain their balance in the direction of the bowl aimed for donations. Needless to say the four people got the hint and made generous donations, one even literally emptied his pockets.

After that she got a more genuine applause and people came forth to put something in the bowl.
111111111111.title: Check it!

choices: They decide to leave before the rope comes over to them.
1111111111111.content:
Mandy manages to make eye contact with the girl who was more or less just waiting for things to settle, so she comes over instead.

“I remember you.” The girl says licking her lips. “Want to take the tour again.” she adds tracing a finger over her belly.

“No, thanks.” Mandy assures. “That hungry again are you?”

“Not quite, but almost, I could really do with your help again, juggling people does wonders for your appetite.”

“I can imagine” Mandy lied, she could sort of imagine it, but juggling people was a hard thing to really relate to even if she'd just seen it done. “You've ever got eaten yourself?”

“Not quite.”

“What kind of an answer is that?”

“Wait and you'll see.” The girl said as she returned to her spot. As she'd been the main and only performing character in the last act the girls had failed to notice the other girls that were similarly dressed, all in the same red clothes.

With her back where she'd been moments before, the girl in the middle started. Likewise athletic she had a thick black hair that was pulled back into a ponytail. It looked good on her as she had the lines for it and the eyes to pull off the piercing dominating act that was required here.
Starting of with kicking a box open somewhat disdainfully.

Inside there were a thick rope and as she gently circled the box she retrieved the end of it and with a flick as if it had been a whip the wave travelled down the rope and as it did the rope unfurled, leaving the box to stretch ever outwards. When the wave reached the end there was no crackle though, instead the rope flopped down dead.

But then the dark haired woman started stroking her end of the rope and the whole length of it seemed to come alive. It slithered to and fro around the circular clearing and soon started climbing up and around the other five performers that were in the clearing, the redhead amongst them. All of them looking bothered as it slithered past them and then around their legs and as the rope coiled around them more and more they started trying to push the coils away all failing miserably.

Then they were all tied up like knots on the long rope struggling helplessly within the rope's coils and the girl in the middle put her end of the rope in her mouth, after which the rope started slithering down her throat.
As the first girl started entering her mouth the rope started rising ever higher, so that the second and third girl were directly over the dark haired girl's mouth before the first girl had gone down it, leaving only the slightest bulge in the woman's throat. Her face was now turned skywards with her head tilted back, offering the straightest path to her stomach and the girls eased in one after the other, the second just gone as the rope had straightened itself completely above her.

Mandy watched in fascination as the girl who had eaten her descended towards this other woman's mouth and the girl below her disappeared, then it was her turn and she made no more of a bulge than the three before her and as the last one vanished the hungry girl remaining sucked in the remaining rope with a slurping noise and as her throat cleared her belly didn't show any sign of her friends.

She took a bow, receiving some applause, then she looked bothered and with a cough the rope flew from her mouth in a big lump and landed in the box with a loud impact that almost tipped it over, but it righted itself and settled with a thud that closed the lid, though not all coils were inside the box so it couldn't close fully.
Continuing with her bothered expression the girl then let out a dainty burp.
“Sorry must have been someone I ate.” she giggled and got another more hearty round of applause and cheers.

As she did the rope wiggled back out of the box and picked up the donations bowl and started making its way around the circle with it.

The girls realise that they don't have any of their money to donate.
1111111111111.title: Talk.

11111111111111.content:
They all see the bowl and the slithering rope approach and Mandy hasn't got anything, it all got digested earlier, so she looks at her friends, she's got this feeling that donating might not be a bad idea.

“We don't have any of their money.” Bethany explains while Amy fishes out her wallet, she might not have their money, but she could give them some of hers, she considers the coins, but then she hardly has any, mostly just single cents, so she flips up a couple of dollar bills, but just feels cheap, so when the rope reaches her she tosses a twenty into the bowl and to her surprise it disappears and two silver coins the size of half dollars land in the bowl instead.
She's quite surprised and as she looks up she sees the dark haired girl in the middle giving her an appreciative bow.

Not sure what happened she figured that there must be some enchantment or something active, possibly the bowl is enchanted, twenty bucks is quite a bit of money, that it'd be equivalent to two large silver coins didn't sound unlikely to her, perhaps the enchantment sort of made the exchange for her?
That made her wonder if there were such an exchange office or stall around, it'd be a lot easier for them to buy things if they could get some local currency.

“Thanks!” Mandy said, feeling a lot more at ease, especially after that bow from the center girl.
She hadn't seen her release the others, but clearly they were busy drying of her spittle.

Perhaps this would be a good time to leave?
11111111111111.title: Donate.

111111111111111.content:
While people are still applauding and tossing coins Amy sees the woman who led the last act smile at her and give her a nod. Though Amy has no idea what she means, they've decided to stay for another show, so she waits to see what's going to happen.
But the woman's eyes doesn't seem to leave her, it's then she feels the rope slithering up her thighs, it's not rough, like the thick hemp it looks like made her think it would be, instead it's smooth and soft.
Quickly it slithered up her body and relieves her of her handbag, handing it to Mandy before it slithers around her a few more times. Diving underneath her garments in the process so that runs down her pants in front and wiggles up between her cheeks while at the same time circulating her two soft mounds beneath her tight top.

It's anything but unpleasant, so as her legs give way the rope holds her up, while it brings her back to its mistress, who brushes Amy's hair aside with a hand before giving the girl a kiss on the mouth.
Then Amy's head slips into the woman's mouth and the rope slithers in, dragging the rest of her with it.

Amy thought the rope felt good, but as the woman's giant tongue starts assaulting her she wishes the rope could just get out of the way, but with her clothes on it's not really the rope that’s the biggest problem. The woman is gentle though, so as Amy quakes through a climax, her clothes are still whole and the woman keeps her inside her warm wet mouth until she's done. Then the rope pulls Amy back out again and places her on the ground on shaky knees, to stagger back to her friends.

“Ohh...that was something...” Amy moans as her friends lend her support.

“That good huh?” Beth grins.

“Mmm...” is all the answer Amy gives while Mandy looks sceptical, she thought Amy was just about to take the journey she'd taken herself earlier. This woman didn't seem any less dangerous than the redhead that had eaten her, rather the opposite. And as such she'd watched the woman's throat for any indication of Amy going down it and into that toned belly, luckily it hadn't come to that.
111111111111111.title: Roped in.

1111111111111111.content:
“Okay, I think that's enough.” Mandy said as she started dragging Amy away from the performers, through the ring of spectators.
Bethany didn't say anything, she had gotten quite the scare when Amy vanished into the woman's mouth, the only one protesting was Amy, who wasn't quite back to her own self just yet and not really in a position to prevent the other two from pulling her along.

As soon as they were outside the ring they couldn't make out what was going on inside, but Mandy figured they were too close at any rate and continued down a market street with the other two in semi-tow before stopping.

“So what do we do now?” Mandy asked.

“Dunno, but I'm getting a bit hungry.” Beth admitted and Amy added a “Me too.”

Mandy realized she wasn't, but then she'd spent most of the time here as remains after having been someone else's food. A thought that didn't really fill her with great confidence and watching her friends rub their empty stomachs made her a little uneasy. She could recall Amy offer her a ride in that gut of hers as a joke, it wasn't funnier now.

“So shall we see what the market has to offer, or should we go home and eat?” Mandy said, taking another chance to put the word home into the conversation.
1111111111111111.title: Enough.

choices: They search for a market exchange stall or something.
11111111111111111.content:
I'd like to see what they have to offer here, I'm sure it'll be a lot more interesting than what we have at home.” Amy said and seeing as it was her home she'd be the one to know, so Bethany nodded her approval.

“That sounds good to me.” She said with a bit of a pause. “But we still have the money issue.”

“Well my money seemed to work fine for the performers.” Amy said with confidence.

“Yeah, but you think that's normal, even for here?” Mandy interjected.

“Might not be.” Bethany agreed. “Keep a lookout for an exchange stall or something, I'm sure food is everywhere, I can recall quite a variety when we walked about earlier.”

The trio then set out, it turned out that there wasn't a whole lot of food where they were, plenty of candy, but two of them at least were more interested in something more substantial. Then Amy's nose picked up something and her belly growled in response.

“Oh, follow me!” She said and hurried around a corner.

A few stalls down she stopped and the two following saw her fiddle with her purse, as they got closer they noticed why, the smell of freshly baked buns was quite intoxicating.

“Do you take this kind of money?” Amy asked the man behind the counter hopefully.

“Sorry lady, the buns are a half small silver a piece and the wheat wreaths are a small silver and two large coppers a piece. ” The vendor said, adding: “I'll take the same in just coppers too, but I'd rather not.”

“Well humour me at least and hold this would you?” Amy said and handed over a ten dollar bill. The man looked sceptical but did as she asked, but as he took it and she let go she saw that nothing happened. “Oh, never mind then.” She said and retrieved her piece of paper.

“You don't happen to know where we could make a money exchange by any chance, do you?”

“Sorry, I'm just a peddler of sorts, but I'm sure the city has a bank or two, it'd be weird otherwise.” He offered hoping the girls would come back to buy his wares once they had the coin.
11111111111111111.title: Market food.

choices: They decide to return to it though.
They decide to explore the city for a bit.
111111111111111111.content:
“Bank sounds like the safest bet to me, because it seems this market may have everything, but not when one is looking for it.” Mandy said semi-cursing the place, she still hadn't seen a pair of decent pants.

“Right...” Bethany agreed. “I wouldn't mind getting away from this heat for a while again either.” She said and led the other two away, towards the closest buildings they could find, which was not that far it would seem.

Once they reached the edge of the market they looked up at stone buildings that looked very similar to the one where Mandy had emerged from a redhead they had encountered.
Looking about Bethany tried to determine her location and decided that the building in question should be down to her right because this should be the same edge, if her guess was correct it should only be a couple of hundred meters away at the most.

But more importantly the crowd opened up amongst the stone buildings as they left the market behind. Not that they went far, they'd all sort of figured out that once they left the market they should be a lot more likely to encounter citizens and thus people that should know where to find a bank.

“Excuse me sir...” Bethany said as she stepped up to a gentleman that looked clean enough and clothed in such a way that she figured that he'd be wealthy enough to require the aid of a bank every now and then. She herself was starting to look a bit taken by the heat, but still appealing, so he didn't shy away even if he was surprised.

“Yes young lady?”

“Would you know where we could find a bank Good Sir?” She said laying the politeness on thick.

“Certainly!” he said, the edge of his mouth rising a bit in a semblance of a smile. “See there by the red building...” he pointed waiting for her to nod. “Take the street hither to the right, then halfway down on the right you should see a distinguished building. That, dear lady, would be the establishment you seek.” He concluded with a bow and all three of them curtsied in return.

True enough, the bank was indeed well distinguished from the surrounding, by comparison, quite bland buildings and above the grand entrance they could read: 'Gold Hawk Holdings'.

The inside wasn't that impressive though, the interior what you'd expect in a small town bank and there were half a dozen cashier-slots in the wall that cut across the room, separating the customer part from the bank interior. Only two were manned though, but there didn’t seem to be anyone waiting in queue, so the girls walked up to closest of the bored looking cashiers.

“Can I help you ladies?” He offered.

“Yes, we'd like to exchange foreign currency for the local coinage.” Amy said, taking her friends a bit by surprise, even though that was exactly what they wanted to do.

“Put the money here please.” He said and a box shot out, onto the small counter in front of his booth.

Bethany had already fished out her money while Amy was talking, so she put it all into the box, figuring that there was no need for their money here, she could get more when she got home, which was the only place she needed it. As they used coins here she figured that she could just as well get rid of the ones she had, so that there wouldn't be any mix-ups.
And before Amy could add her money the cashier had retracted the box and quickly sorted it out, Amy hadn't even opened her purse when the man pushed the box back out again and Bethany looked down happy that it had worked, inside she saw a pile of coins, silver and copper that she retrieved.

“Hey, I want to make an exchange as well!” Amy protested when the man pulled in the empty box.

“Sorry madam, my mistake.” He apologized and Amy dumped a fist full of bills into it and after seeing Bethany get rid of her coins she did the same.

The man handled her exchange just as quickly and Bethany raised both eyebrows as she saw the pile in the box when it came back out again. “Girl, how much money do you carry around?”

“A bit.” Was all the reply she got while Amy shoved fist after fist into her purse.

“Would you also like to exchange your money my lady?” The man queried, looking at Mandy.

“I would, but they got eaten.” She replied, to which he raised and eyebrow, retracted the box and went back to looking bored.

Now with local currency the girls were a lot happier, now they weren't just at a weird and yet spectacular market, now they had the means to actually buy things.
Well they weren't exactly at the market...
111111111111111111.title: Banking.

1111111111111111111.content:
As they left the bank Amy could almost smell those buns, she knew there aught to be bakeries and restaurants and what not even in the city, but she wanted to get back up to the market, and her stomach told her to hurry, quite loudly.

They didn't return the way they had come though, since they wanted back to the market and not really to a specific place they took the shortest route and there were bound to be other stalls selling buns and what not, in fact by the time they returned to the market Amy had already forgotten those buns.

She hadn't forgotten her appetite though, so she did hurry ahead of a her friends a bit, looking at everything that seemed edible. Now even the candy stalls got her attention, perhaps partly because she had the time while her friends caught up to her.

They heard Amy giggle as she surveyed a stall up ahead. “You've got to see this Mandy...” she called as the other two approached her. “It kind of looks like you.” she said giggling again.

As Mandy stepped up to Amy and looked at what she meant, she found it to be a girl-shaped piece of candy that was probably some kind of vanilla and toffee mix judging by the colours, giving the candy-girl light skin and brown hair and clothes.

“There is some resemblance.” Bethany giggled.

“Oh, you want to eat me again?” Mandy said, trying to keep light hearted.

“You know I do, you look so tasty.” Amy giggled back.

“We have a product I think you might be interested in.” The cute young brunette behind the counter interjected, looking like she was about the same age as themselves. “It's a bit pricier, so I don't have it up on the counter.”
1111111111111111111.title: Market treats.

choices: They continue in the direction they were going.
11111111111111111111.content:
“Sorry, we're not really interested.” Amy apologised, she wasn't looking for candy, she was looking for food.

So the trio continued on, this time more together, but food seemed to avoid them, lots of candy, even cookies. Amy recalled the buns, but she really wanted something more.

After a while they all noticed how everything seemed stranger, the people, their hats and their clothes, even the vendors and their wares. Somehow there were more cryptic items and decorations.
It was then that Amy spotted a food stand.

“Freaking finally!” She exclaimed and pushed ahead.

As she got there she found herself facing a wooden wall, but the stall wasn't closed, it was just that the counter was that high and a girl looked down at her over it, the girl didn't look disproportional, so Amy assumed she was standing on some ledge, or elevated floor.

“What do you want?” The girl queried before Amy had a chance to take note of what kind of things they offered.

“What do you sell?”

“Stuffed longbreads.” The girl answered.

“Then I'll take a large one.” Amy answered, figuring that the girl meant that they sold submarine sandwiches or something similar and she was really hungry.

“Kind of Large, Actually Large, Really Large, Very Large, Very Very Large, Huge, or Freaking Huge?” The girl wondered.

“That's quite the variety of large! How big are they?” Amy asked.

“Umm... kind of large is about this big...” The girl said indicating half a baguette. “...Actually large is about this big...” She continued showing something the size of a whole baguette. “...Really large is not so much longer as it is thicker...” she said and looked at Amy “...like your leg perhaps...and very large a bit thicker still and would probably reach you to your waist if it stood on its end... Very very large, is about your size...”

“Okay, I get the picture...” Amy interrupted, she didn't need anything that big, what she did need was food now. “What stuffings do you have?”

“There's a list there...” The girl leaned over and pointed to the corner of the wooden wall counter. “...Goblin stuffing is only available for Very Very Large and larger breads though.” The girl said as if the warning was needed.

“Goblin?” Amy wondered as pausing to look up at the girl again.

“Yeah, you know, little night-creatures, pointy ears and noses?” She said, half explanation, half question, unable to comprehend that someone didn't know what a goblin was.

Amy didn't need the girl to tell her why that stuffing only was available for the larger breads though, clearly it was the creatures that were in it and not their top chef's favourite goop.

She ended up ordering an Actually Large, with a bunch of stuff in it, figuring that there wasn't really any need for the other two to go through this.
It turned out to be quite delicious and both her and Bethany could eat their fill. Mandy too had some, but she wasn't that hungry to begin with.
Afterwards though they were all happier campers and ready to give the market a more serious browsing.
11111111111111111111.title: Not interested.

111111111111111111111.content:
They continue down the road they were walking and see that soon there isn't a bracelet, or a hair pin, that doesn't have some rune or other on it. Some of it looks pretty stylish though, so it's not all bad weirdness. Though perhaps a bit much jewellery, so they sort of start ignoring those and look for other things.

“This, ladies, is the latest in both board-gaming and home entertainment!” The lady behind the counter assures, she was dressed like a female nerd out of some gamers-con and were one of those that had both a good enough costume and looks to be quite busy posing for people taking pictures.

Her elaborate costume had made both Mandy and Amy look, so when she addressed them they took notice since she didn't approach them in the bothersome 'Buy my shit'- kind of way most vendors used, but more 'Look at this! This is so awesome! You've got to see this!'- fashion, which turned out to grab the girls attention effectively.

They hadn't paid her stall any mind, so they didn't know what she was selling, but it was fairly obvious that it was games after just a quick glance, but as she'd been so up about something they couldn't help but wonder; What?

She could see the girls' faces turning very sceptical, so she quickly cleared a spot at the center of her desk and pulled forth her show item. “Bear with me girls, you don't look like gamers, but trust me. This is cool!” She said trying to keep the three of them from leaving.

“So what is it?” Mandy wondered looking at the large clear dome that sprouted from a metal frame with a flat bottom so it stood firmly on the counter.

“It's called 'Stage Fight!' and it's sort of a gladiator game.” Again she could see the sceptic looks in the girls faces. “No, no, I know what you think, it's not your thing and bla-bla. Just let me give you a demonstration!”

“Okay...” Amy said while her two friends nodded somewhat reluctantly.

“You see the inside of the dome here is the arena and on each side here is a console.” She pointed and they could see the one's closest to them. “They are all identical and for one player each. So each player makes a character and then joins the game. As they do the console locks until they leave the game. Characters are personal, so everyone that wants to play has to make a new character, the game remembers though, so you don't need to make a new character every time.”

“So, I need two players. What's your name?” The saleswoman said as she started fiddling with the console.

“Mandy.”

“Okay, so what kind of character do you want to be?”

“Well, me?” Mandy said, not really into the whole making crazy fantasy creature shit up on the fly.

“Okay, that's fine I suppose. So human?” She asked waiting for a nod, which made Mandy wonder; 'Wasn't that obvious?' before she continued “Female...young...some...” it wasn't really questions, but she paused to eye Mandy over. “...sixteen and a half palms tall...slim...” she kept on pressing a bit with only a bit on humming.

Turning the game a quarter of the way round she accessed the next terminal. “That should do it, remember Mandy that's your terminal. Now how about you?” She said looking at Amy. “What do you want your character to be?”

“The same.” Amy said thinking the clerk world get it and hurry on.

“You want your character to look like Mandy and be identical to hers?” She said with a bit of surprise.

The reply also shocked Amy in turn. “That's possible?”

“Yeah, sure.”

Then Amy realized it was a game and that she just meant the generic character she'd just made for Mandy. “What I meant was I wanted a character like me, you know human and what not that you said.”

“Oh, sure.” The lady said this time only asking for her name, but not speaking out everything she did, instead just looking up a few times to evaluate Amy before she turned the gameboard around so that the girls could access their relative terminals.

“There, that should do it!” she smiled “Ready to begin?”
111111111111111111111.title: Stage Fight!

choices: They take a turn or two, to see what's there.
They continue down the same lane.
1111111111111111111111.content:
“Yeah...” the two girls say in unison and equally unsure.

“Great! Then press the start button inside that big slot up next to the dome.” The lady behind the counter explained as she tried to make out if they understood her seeing as she couldn't really see their terminals herself.

But both girls understood what she meant, they had to insert most of their hand to press the button, but as they did something happened. They found themselves standing in a dark metal hallway and slowly one end of it opened up like a big two door gate, opening in the middle and from the opening streamed light.

It was a no brainier that they were supposed to go that way and leave the hallway, so they did, both stopping in the opening as they realized that the gate led out onto the now huge open field of the arena that was the floor of the dome and the light was shining down on them from outside the dome. Through its clear surface they could see a chocked Bethany and a grinning pretty nerd saleswoman looking down on them like enormous giants.

“That's them?!” they could hear Bethany ask.

“Yes, you play as your character. That's what makes the game so awesome.”

“Okay, so what do you do? I don't think they know either.” Beth asked, while also explaining the girls' predicament.

“You defeat your opponents of course, it's a gladiator game.” She said as if it had been so obvious. She then took a closer look at the two girls inside looking confused. “Oh, right, I forgot to give you any special powers, you wanted to be bland...and seeing as you didn't carry any weapons I guess I forgot to give you that as well.” The saleswoman said with an 'ops'-expression. “I'm afraid this would make for a boring fight. Why don't one of you just kick the other to her butt and make her yield, so we can end this game?”

Amy looked like she really wanted to give Mandy a serious kick, but Mandy wasn't that interested in fighting her friend.
“Stop Amy, I'll yield.” She said sitting down and then laying herself back on the floor. “Now you can sit on me and I can say I yield right?”

Amy did just that and looked up at the gigantic lady who just looked repulsed. “Now what?”

“She needs to tap out.” She said with disgust while Mandy complied quickly.

The two in the arena found the dome going dark and then they found themselves standing and having the need to open their eyes, despite not remembering closing them. As they did, they found themselves standing next to their respective terminal again.

“I'm sorry, it's my fault that was the most pathetic fight, ever. I guess I'm so used to seeing people throwing fireballs and having extra bodyparts and flying around in there and such, that I forgot that that doesn't happen unless the characters in there are capable of that and have the equipment.”

“So that's possible?” Amy said, a bit more intrigued than her friends.

“Sure, that and much more, but like I might have forgotten to say, all characters start out pretty wimpy, it's not until you level up a bit that things start to get really fun. I think you only got one experience point for that tragic win though, possibly you didn't get any at all.”

“What if you don't want to fight your friends?” Mandy wondered.

“Well then there are two things you can do, buy arena creatures.” She said and held up a sphere that looked like something you'd pop out of a gum-ball machine. “You place this in a terminal and the creature enters when the game starts. There are a lot of different creatures, I have a few up, but there's a magazine here listing the ones I've got.” She continued, fetching a pamphlet-sized magazine that looked to be hundreds of pages thick and slid it across the counter next to the game.

“The other thing you can do, is find opponents that you want to beat good and proper.”

“So why did you put us against one another?”

“Well I wanted to show you. The awe as you step into the dome for the first time is quite something, isn't it?” She smiled. “I just sort of forgot that you couldn't do a whole lot once you were there.”

“So how much is the game?” Amy wondered, it was cool, she couldn't disagree with that, even if she didn't get to see the flying and throwing balls of lightning bit.

“The basic game is one large gold.” She started, but was interrupted by Amy, who didn't see herself carry around this giant game on the market now anyhow, but still wanted to know.

“How many silver is that?”

“One hundred large, or five hundred small.” The sales woman explained.

“Oh...” Amy said, she'd gotten a bit of silver when doing her exchange, but nothing close to that. “...and what's in the basic game?”

“Just the game you see here, arena with four terminals. There are a few feature options that comes with it, like blocked view, so that onlookers can't see through the dome, blue sky setting and grass ground option I think. That's about it. The basic list of items and skills for characters is a bit more extensive than the word basic implies though, but for terrain options and other flashy stuff it really is basic. There are lots of add-ons though.”

“Any arena creatures?”

“None, but creatures aren't necessarily so bad. They go from coppers a piece to as much as the game, but as you start out I think it's the cheap stuff you're interested in practising against anyhow. And after spending a solid gold on the game, a couple of silvers on creatures hardly make much of a difference, does it?”

“Not the cheapest of hobbies is it?” Amy joked.

“No, afraid not, and at a large gold it's still a steal. And don't bother looking for a competitor, I'm the only one in town with a licence to sell it and trust me, I'm too much of a gamer to boost the prices too high, that'd mean I'd miss out on people to play against.” She said grinning like mad.

“Well it's not just a bit much to carry around the market, but a bit more than I've got money for at the moment as well.” Amy said, she was quite intrigued.

“I see.” The shop-keep nodded.

“But you will be here for a few days I assume?”

“I will, I don't plan on leaving soon.” The gamer girl smiled as she watched the three girls carry on.
1111111111111111111111.title: Gaming?

choices: Something that moves about a bit.
11111111111111111111111.content:
They leave the game vendor behind and looking down the paths, as a lane crosses the one they are walking on, Mandy sees something that interests her and goes down that way before the other two finally notices what is up and come after her.

They find that a stall selling these amazing dresses had caught her attention, rich fabrics, fine designs and splendid decorations...decorations that like most here looked like some sort of mix of cryptic symbols.
One dress in particular caught Mandy's eyes, a short, tight thing, that'd end just below the bum and cling to the body from there, with arms that stopped below the elbow and hardly anything from shoulder to shoulder, showing a lot of skin there and down, a bit...

Mandy realized that even if the dress wasn't magic, it'd be quite expensive and considering that it probably was, she doubted that Amy even could borrow her that much money and if she could, did she really want to spend that kind of money on a dress?

Probably not, she decided, but gawked a bit more until her friends sounded impatient.
Then she surprised them by simply leaving.

“Wait, I thought you wanted that dress.” Beth said as she finally caught up with Mandy.

“Well, yeah, I think you did too. I just didn't want to hear the price though, I prefer to dream that I could afford it.” Mandy said with a soft dreamy smile on her face.

“Ahh...” Bethany answered, thinking that Mandy was probably right about that part, before realising that Amy wasn't with them.

Stopping Mandy with a hand on her shoulder she made her aware of that fact and the two scanned the area, taking a couple of minutes to find their friend. She was a few stalls down, so she'd been hard to spot.

“What are you doing?” Bethany wondered as they stepped over to see what occupied the blonde, who looked like she was browsing this stand fairly thoroughly.

“Just looking for a little treat.” She answered.

“But we just ate?” Beth said puzzled, having not quite paid the vendor's wares any attention yet.

“Ahh, but this is candy.” Amy said as if that explained everything.

“Somewhat of an acquired taste.” The oddly clad young woman behind the counter interjected as she noticed Mandy and Bethany turn their eyes to her wares.
“It's animated candy...” She said stepping forward a bit so they could see her better. “These ones here are what we call wigglers, they just squirm a bit as you eat them and in the belly.” She said motioning to the left end. “And as you go over here they get feistier and tougher, giving you a bit more pleasant struggling and also lasting a bit longer.” She continued with a pleasant salesman smile. “The scale increases on the shelves behind me until they actually put up a bit of a fight.” She chuckled as she tapped a small clear container with a little creature inside, it was too dim that far back compared to the light outside the stall for them to make it out though.

Returning to the counter the lady went on; “Like I said, a bit of an acquired taste, not everyone likes their snacks to disagree with them. And don't be fooled by the different sizes, the large wigglers are still just wigglers...” She said tapping a large clear container with a manshaped candy inside. “...and the small feisty ones are still feisty.” she continued pointing with her thumb over her shoulders generally to the shelves behind her.

“So are you interested in something?”

Amy who had already looked through the assorted wares for a while looked to her friends for aid. She'd figured that this should be pretty interesting, and had the game they looked at still in the back of her head to some degree, so toyfighting with a piece of candy sounded rather fun to her. “So what do you think girls, should I go for some wiggler, or something a bit more lively?”
11111111111111111111111.title: Browsing.

choices: She puts it away till later.
111111111111111111111111.content:
Mandy and Beth looked at the candy creatures in the clear containers. The ones on the wigglerscale looked completely still, and as they moved onto the right the little creatures seemed to move about more and more, albeit in slow-motion and nothing fancy, just stepping back and forth, or scratching some bodypart or other. What struck them mostly was how detailed the creatures were, nearly all were humanoid in shape, but not necessarily human. There also seemed to be a vast majority of female creatures especially as they moved onto the right and most seemed to be a bit translucent, which was why at first they hadn't noticed the details and also what made them look so candylike. Well that and the colours, as nearly all creatures were one colour all over and some typical candy colour at that.

“Go with something that moves a bit.” Mandy said.

“Yeah, the ones that are completely still over there looks no fun at all.” Beth agreed while Amy looked down where her friends were looking roughly in the middle of the stall.

“Okay, then I think this one looks good.” She said pointing to a container with a purple lithe looking woman about as tall as her hand inside, expecting the clerk to either take it, or produce one like it from some hidden stash.
