“The container is a seal, once you open it, they will start to move about properly.” The woman explained as she picked up the chosen container to verify the price and then put it down on the counter. “If it wasn't for the seal calming them down, even the wigglers would eventually try to squirm their way out of the containers and well, I guess you understand how that would be a problem.” She chucked while Amy produced her purse.

“Can you bite them?” Amy said, realising that it might be a bit hard to swallow something this big, even if it didn't struggle at all, she'd sort of forgotten the part about her not usually swallowing her food whole, but even if it was just struggling inside her mouth that'd have to do.

“I guess, they are candy. But it would defeat the purpose, now wouldn’t it?” The vendor said, finding the question a bit odd. “If you bite off their limbs they won't be able to struggle with them, now will they?” She explained her point of view.

“I guess you're right.” Amy smiled, not wanting to bring up her particular problem in the conversation.

“That'll be a large silver.” The woman said, looking a bit surprised when Amy paid her. It wasn't until she had handed the coin over that she realized that she was supposed to haggle the price. Judging by the saleswoman's expression she should have paid half as much at the most.

Amy just shrugged her shoulders as she left with her purchase in one hand. At least now she knew, and ten bucks for something like this wasn't that bad she thought, it wasn't like she could buy moving candy at home.
111111111111111111111111.title: Moves a bit.

1111111111111111111111111.content:
Amy holds it up as she walks away, it's a lot easier to see the purple female candy-creature in the light outside the stall. Turns out she's pretty athletic and that she's got a bit of skimpy clothing on, but it looks to be as much part of her as the scales she's got in places or her strange hair, so perhaps clothes isn't the right word, it might be better to refer to it as a detail just like her pointy ears.

“You gonna eat it?” Mandy wondered.

“Not now, I think I want to bring it home, ya know, pay it proper attention. It's not like I've ever bought or eaten something like this before.” Amy said and started bringing it towards her purse, before she stopped herself and offered it to Mandy. “You want a closer look?”

“Sure.” Mandy smiled and accepted the creature who stumbled around inside the clear container as it was manhandled.

The three continued down the stalls, a bit slowly as it was hard to keep any pace up while studying an object, and after Mandy was through, Bethany had a look as well. It was when she handed the creature back to its owner that Amy spoke of what had bothered her.

“Is it me, or are there less people?” She wondered as she put the cylinder away and her two friends looked around.

“Yeah.” Bethany agreed. “It's clearly thinning out.”

“Might be getting late?” Mandy offered, she realised that she didn't know how much of the day she had missed.

“Yeah...” Bethany accepted the explanation. “... the sun clearly isn't anywhere as high as it used to be.” She said looking up. “Amy, didn't you take some photos? How long ago was that?”

“One second...” Amy said as she fished her phone out again and scrolled for the pictures she took of Mandy in the jar, finding them a bit weird and kept looking between them and Mandy. “...Like five hours and change.”

“And we'd been here like an hour and a half, or two by then?” Beth continued looking at Amy since Mandy wasn't really around at the time.

“I think so.”

“So that means that even if we got here before noon, it'd be getting pretty late by now.”

“How long to the gate?” Mandy wondered, seeing as Beth had somehow kept some track of where they were.

“About an hour I suppose, but we'd have to actually find it once we get there too.”

“Yeah, so I suppose the question is, do we want to see this city by night, or take that another time and head on home?” Mandy asked, she'd gotten somewhat used to her odd garb, people hadn't been looking at her like she thought they would, in fact there were much stranger outfits around and certainly a lot more revealing ones.
1111111111111111111111111.title: Putting it away.

11111111111111111111111111.content:
“I've got no idea why my feet aren't killing me if we've been walking around for that long, but I'm certain I want to sleep in my own bed tonight and if the people are leaving, it's probable that they close the market. Which would mean that we can't access the portal.” Amy said, neglecting to mention that she was also a bit interested in studying her latest purchase in the comfort of her home.

“Yeah, I'll lead the way then huh?” Bethany asked.

“Yes, I think you might be the one that knows it best.” Mandy agreed. “No need to hurry though, we might find something interesting on the way back, if we have time to browse.” She added.

So Bethany didn't as she'd first considered. That is, head back to the edge of the market and follow it back to where she remembered those houses and then backtrack their steps to the stall they emerged from. Now she had to guess the general direction and cut across the market there. It should in theory be a shorter way, but, well one has to know where one is as well.

She didn't get far though before Amy stopped her.

“What?”

“I just figured we've seen jewellery all over the market all day, but we've never really looked at any and we did give ours up earlier. And I know we could look over on the end where we arrived, but I recall they all looked like normal jewellery, while most here look weird.” Amy said. “So can we at least have a quick look here?” She added pointing to the jewellery stand close by.

“I guess, it doesn't matter if we look here or later as long as we look, it should take as long.” Bethany said a little grumpy, since she was reminded that she had given up her ring.

“So what's up with these cryptic things?” Amy asked the lady in the stall, who leaned out to have a look. “They do anything?”

“Nah, not those, they are just pretty.”

“So you have items that do things?” Amy continued.

“Sure. Earrings over there, next to you, alter your hair.” she answered and Amy looked at the assorted pieces.

“Mind if I try a pair on?” She asked.

“Hmm...” The shopkeep said, clearly not that fond of costumers trying the merchandise before purchase. “...All right, ONE pair.” she agreed.

Amy looked through the various items, there being no label on what they actually did, she just had to choose a pair she liked and then find out. So she found clean tasteful ones in silver and started putting them on, but as soon as she had one on Mandy's reaction stopped her. “What?”

“Afro.” Mandy giggled. “Put the other one on, you look silly with a half afro.”

“I bet, Amy said, looking around for a mirror, finding none before she remembered her phone and fetched it out, unlocking it before handing it to Mandy. “Here take some pictures.” Amy said, making the second earpiece ready, but waiting to put it on before Mandy had taken a couple of shots of her blonde half afro haircut.

She had soon returned the earrings and Mandy looked around, remembering that she had also lost her piercings, the one in her bellybutton being the only one that survived digestion, but ended up part of the price to undo the digestion. She wanted one though and found a set of rings and rods on a rack to the side.
“So what do these do?” she asked.

“Oh, they also alter the hair, mostly the colour, but a place a little lower.” The shopkeep hinted.

Mandy looked down, smiling a bit, it'd be kind of funny, but then as she looked down she noticed that she didn't have a hole to put a rod in, it was as if she'd never been pierced. She put her hand to her ear. “Hmm... seems I healed a bit more than I thought...my piercings are gone.”

“That's interesting.” Bethany said and had a look herself, Mandy really didn't have any holes, her ears were pristine.

“So you have items that do more interesting things?” Amy wondered, bringing the focus back to the wares at hand.

“Sure in the back.” The saleswoman said.
11111111111111111111111111.title: Heading.

choices: They have a look at the show first.
111111111111111111111111111.content:
“Sorry we don't have the time.” Bethany interrupted, as she realized this could drag on forever, with the shopkeep not having marked anything, as in neither prices, nor effects, if at least the prices had been out they could have looked for something affordable and then asked what it did.

Amy looked back at her as if to protest. “We'll come back tomorrow Amy.” Beth assured, though thinking that she'd probably search for another stand, or leave Amy here for the day.

“Al-right.” The blonde girl resigned and walked back outside.

And as they continued on Mandy found lots of places that sold skirts, dresses and pants, but now that they were going home she didn't really see the point. Well she could always look out a nice garment, but she'd rather not look at clothes with someone standing behind her tapping their foot and asking her to hurry up. In that case she could just as well borrow something from Amy until she got home, even if she knew it'd fit bad.

Now Mandy found that she concentrated on just them it would seem, there were probably dozens of other vendors for every clothes salesman, but all she could seem to focus on were those few. Perhaps because they annoyed her so, she'd been looking for them all day and NOW they decide to show up!

But neither of the other girls seemed to find anything interesting either, they did find the crowds thinning out though, even here as they started hearing the racket from some performers. The ones they had watched earlier, or some other group that had taken up roughly the same spot at least, Bethany thought, as she was fairly confident that they were walking the right way.
111111111111111111111111111.title: Not the time.

choices: They try and fix the gate.
They decide to see what magic candy is like.
1111111111111111111111111111.content:
Bethany considers leading her friends over to the performers for a look, it's hard to say that it wasn't interesting to watch and she sort of want to verify that it's the same ones, because that'd mean that she'd have a rough idea of where they are.
But one of the vendors starting to pack his things up, convinces her that it's probably best to access their portal while they can.

So she navigates around the performers and then head back towards the edge of the market, until she can see the stone buildings at the end of the lanes, when one is leading that way, until she feels satisfied that this should be the one where Mandy and that performing girl parted ways.

“Amy, help me would you?” Bethany asked, as she tried to backtrack their way there from where they had emerged. They made a couple of wrong choices, but it only meant that they'd taken a parallel street and not some huge mistake. So after a while they thought things looked kind of familiar, despite the different lighting. It was still bright, but the sun was certainly on the way down.

“Okay, so how do we do this?” Mandy wondered as they finally found the vendor they were looking for, as she was the one without a key.

“Well...” Bethany started, trying to come up with a plan. “How about you hold onto Amy when she goes through and I'll stay behind if it doesn't work?”

“Hmm... yeah, al-right.” Mandy said and took Amy's hand, then as the two approached the portal she put her other on Amy's shoulder and held on.

Bethany watched as the two went in and saw the flash, then as it went away she noticed how the tent fabric of the stall was pushed out and then Mandy came back through the portal, walking through it as if it wasn't there.
“What happened?”

“It didn't work! That's what happened.” Mandy grumbled. “At first I thought I felt like I was coming through with her, but then I had the tent in my face.”

“Oh, so it...” Bethany stopped herself. “Was there anything else Amy left behind?” She wondered.

“Dunno...” Mandy said and went back to look but she didn't see anything, not on the far side of the portal either. “Can't find anything, so I don't think so.”

“So what made you different than the other things she carried with her?” Bethany asked, trying to solve the problem.

“Well...” Mandy started before paying attention to Beth's choice of words. “She didn't carry me.”

“You think that might be it?”

“Well it's either that, or that I'm a person.”

“So are you willing to give it a try?”

“Give what a try?” Mandy asked a little weary.

“Me carrying you.”

“Oh, yeah piggyback style.” Mandy said smiling.

“What did you think I wanted to do?” Bethany wondered as she prepared to have Mandy jump up on her back.

“Try and find a way to make it so I wasn't a person. The offer didn't really appeal to me after the experience I got earlier.” Mandy answered tongue, in cheek-ish, before she jumped onto her friend's back, causing her to take a couple of steps before finding her balance.

“So are you ready?” Bethany asked as she moved towards the portal.

“I guess... Like I said I don't like the alternative.”

“I could ask Amy to come back and get you, she did offer you to take that ride.” Bethany giggled as she leaned forward a bit and stumbled into and through the portal.

“There you are!” Amy shone up. “I was getti...” She cut herself off and her two friends looked at her wondering what was up, while Bethany let Mandy drop to the floor of Amy's walk-in closet.

“The portal...” Amy said pointing. “...look at it!”

“Oh...” Both said as they turned around and saw that it had gone grey and dull.

“What's up with that?” Bethany asked and poked it with her wand, but it just went straight through with no reaction.

“I'm glad you stayed behind and made sure I got through Beth.” Mandy said as she saw what happened and when she turned back and saw the blonde she just couldn't help looking at her belly.

“What?” Amy wondered, noticing the strange look she got from Mandy.

“Just the alternative way of getting home we discussed.” Mandy said cryptically, indicating 'we' were her and Bethany, who got the reference and couldn't stop herself from giggling.

“Hey!” Amy protested. “What's so funny?”

“Nothing.” Mandy said, but Bethany elaborated.

“You did offer her a ride, not a piggyback.”

“Oh...” Amy said, realising that Mandy had looked at her gut and not her boobs, or some stain on her shirt. “You know the offer still stands.” She joked, licking her lips. “You do look good enough to eat.” She said giggling as well while grabbing Mandy's butt.

“Hey!” Mandy protested and shoved herself past the shorter girl and out of the small room.

“So what are we going to do about that?” She continued pointing at the now useless portal that didn't want to go away as the other two followed her into Amy's bedroom.

“We should see what's up with that.” Beth said, noticing that the time between the market and their world seemed to correlate pretty well, so it wasn't that late, just late enough for stores to close.

“Or, we could wait with that and have a little fun with this.” Amy said with a grin, holding up the clear cylinder with the trapped candy girl she had bought.
1111111111111111111111111111.title: The Gate.

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
“That sounds nice and fun and all Amy, but I just couldn't enjoy it now that the gate has acted up.” Bethany said. “I'd really like to know what was up so that we could go back there. You do want to go back, right?”

“Yeah.” Mandy said not half as convincing as Amy.

“I know it's not the most fun, but that does mean we have to study the book again.” Beth said and the other two nodded their agreement as they went and fetched the laptop and book respectively.

They had been so eager to try out the ritual once they had covered that part that they hadn't covered what came after, where it clearly said that the wands were keys and that they held two charges each and that it didn't matter how you handled them, if they went through the portal, even if another wand was used for that, they'd use up a charge. It took them a while to find how to recharge it though and it didn't help that they didn't have access to the dictionaries, even if they had covered quite a few Old English words by now.

It turned out that they would need to go to the hippie store again, apparently most of what they needed was there, they couldn't find anything about making a new key though, apart from closing the portal and opening up a new one, which apparently had two problems. It'd require all the items for the original ritual, which meant that they'd spend a lot of time engraving, carving and painting stuff, not to mention the significantly higher cost of the ritual compared to the one needed to recharge the wands. But there was also the issue of the world possibly moving differently, so that if they made a new portal they could end up in a completely different place and the market was pretty neat, not to mention fairly safe. They could otherwise end up in a forest full of wild beasts, or a top a mountain in the middle of nowhere. As it were now they could come safely into the city and then venture out from it if they would feel the need to do that.

While they were busy they talked about a few other things as well, but most interesting was the point Bethany brought up:

“I know this is our secret and school project besides, however weird and little we might actually use of this research.” Bethany had started out. “But I think we should consider bringing someone else in on it.”

“I know it's sort of your discovery.” Mandy said, since it was true, she was just lucky, sort of, that she'd known Bethany to get this adventure. “But who, really?”

“I was thinking maybe your sister?” Bethany said looking at Amy.

“My sister?” She asked dumbfounded. “Seriously?”

“Well it was just a suggestion.” Bethany defended herself, but Amy's sister who was two years older seemed like a decent choice to her, she'd have family ties to them at least and wouldn't look too weird coming into Amy's room, unlike say her own sister. “We should probably discuss what kind of people and who, maybe even if we should bring someone else along.” She concluded.
11111111111111111111111111111.title: Finding a fix.

111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“Okay, so why should we?” Bethany started, hoping that either of the other girls could put words to what she felt.

“Because we want to show it off?” Mandy tried.

“Yeah it is cool.” Amy agreed “But we still don't want the world to know, it's more like a show off to a few thing...right?”

“So... because we want to...” Bethany summarised. “I guess that is as good a reason as any, albeit a bit vague I suppose. I mean I guess I was thinking more along the terms of sharing the fun.”

“Sharing the fun? You're the one keeping your cool.” Mandy said.

“Which is my point, perhaps we need someone crazy, or someone with money that could buy some of the crazy things we saw there, like that game you liked, Amy.” Bethany explained.

“Oh, like I said. You are the sneaky one keeping your head about.” Mandy teased.

“So how about it? Is it a good way to approach?” Beth said, giving Mandy a wink, but looking at Amy.

“I guess... didn't really plan it like that, but now that you mention it, I wouldn't mind buying that game... Not the cheapest of toys, now was it?” Amy said pondering. “So any suggestions on whom to bring? Other than my sister?” She added, the last part as a quick save.

“Don't get what'd be wrong with your sister. She's not that much older than us.” Bethany said thinking of her own sister that was so much older that she hadn't lived at home when she first met these two, so they probably hadn't even seen her. “And she wont look out of place coming into your room, like a few other people we might consider. I mean how many girls from school have you had over really?”

“Mandy, you have any family you'd consider? Like your brothers?” Amy asked, forcefully shifting the topic.

“My brothers?” Mandy said, sounding offended. “They are...” She struggled for words.

“Kinda cute?” Amy offered.

“Seriously?!” Mandy protested. “They both probably have lots of candid pictures of the both of you. They are dirty immature rats that just want to get inside your pants. Heck, sometimes I think they might even be ogling me.” She elaborated, making it quite obvious that she considered them out of the question.

As the other two took in her outburst and tried to gather their wits again Mandy continued. “I have one cousin though.” She started, sounding calm again. “But while I trust her, I'm pretty sure she has friends too that she couldn't keep a thing like this from and I know nothing of whom she hangs with.”

“That, is the problem isn't it?” Bethany said. “That whoever we bring along, they are bound to have someone, like we have each other, that they'd want to bring in on it as well.”

“True, enough, so we probably want people where we also know the best friends. It's not like we want this spreading word of mouth until it isn't a secret, right?” Amy said.

“About that...” Mandy pondered. “So what we want are people that can really keep a secret as well. Any suggestions?”
111111111111111111111111111111.title: Kind of people.

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“I was thinking of Kendra.” Bethany suggested.

“Kendra?!” Amy and Mandy said baffled. “You know her?” Mandy wondered.

“We all know her. I mean, you've been to a single party she's not been to?” Beth asked.

“I think not.” Mandy said and Amy just blushed a little, she'd even had a private little party with Kendra of sorts.

“You mean that you're afraid I'd end up digesting you? A whole person?”

“Yeah, now that you can swallow someone I have a feeling you could quite easily digest them as well, and sis. I do love you, but I'd rather you coughed me back up, like you just did, than pull down your pants when you felt it was time for me to come back out.” Bethany said.

“You should probably try it on something you eat tonight.” Mandy said, getting the feeling that they were leaving. Which turned out to be a fairly accurate assessment of the situation.

“Oh, Adelle.” Bethany said as she headed for the door. “I think you're going to call in sick tomorrow and then call me. You don't want to miss this, I assure you.”
111111111111111111111111112111.title: Bethany's sister.

1111111111111111111111111121111.content:
None of the girls had slept that well that night, most kind of eager to get going and as such the three classmates had met up early enough that the stores hadn't even opened, So they made a last second check before heading out to get the things needed to recharge the wands. They also needed more money, which an ATM easily fixed for two of them, but Mandy had to stay behind and wait for the bank to open, her card had gotten digested like the rest of her things so she'd have to find her passport to even have an ID.

Adelle had taken Mandy's advice and tried a few things out before she hit the sack and then again in the morning. It was weird, when she was wearing it, she could stretch her mouth and she was strong, not weird perhaps you'd need to be strong if you were going to carry people around in your stomach, but she didn't feel any different so it actually felt most weird when she took the garment off and she wasn't strong anymore.

Then there was the thing about digestion, it was strange, she'd eaten again that night even though she'd already had dinner, so she'd just had a small meal, but she could sort of vaguely sense it and then she'd tried digesting it and had felt everything in her system, her previous dinner and all hurry on south so that she had to dash for the bathroom.
At breakfast she tried the same thing, but now it was just her breakfast that ended up down there, so there wasn't much to let out, but she understood what her sister meant about having to keep from digesting them, she was certain that it'd be no problem sending someone through her gut in a very short time. And looking at the tiny lump in the toilet, that was all that remained of her breakfast, before she flushed it away, it felt kind of weird to know that she could do that to a person.

She had procrastinated a bit after that, before she finally called in sick, faking a cough and then called her sister like she'd been asked to.

“We have most of the stuff now.” Bethany had explained, “We're really just waiting for you and Mandy to come over.” she continued. “Remember it's a market on the other side, so bring your purse.”

“About that, do you know what Amy paid for this thing?” Adelle wondered implying the piece of magic armour.

“No idea, a lot is all. I could ask her.” Bethany answered getting the nudge from her sister to do so. “Oh... three hundred freaking bucks...” Beth breathed into the phone.

“Thanks...” Adelle said, she wasn't surprised, the garment alone was quite the piece, that alone was probably worth it and considering what it did, that price was a steal. That didn't mean it wasn't a lot of money though. “They take cards over there?”

“I doubt it, we had to go and change our dollars for their weird pure metal coins, luckily there's a bank not too far away from where the gate is and we'll be heading there first thing I think. And I don't recall seeing anything resembling an ATM, the place has got more of a medieval feel.”

“Okay, then I need to take out some cash first.” Adelle said before she hung up, pondering things over for a minute, before getting ready to leave. She ended up dressed much the same as the girls had seen her, a pair of low cut tight jeans, she wasn't sure if her belly would be huge, it probably would with a person in there, so she took a pair that she thought wouldn't be in the way and a rather stylish backpack, since they had said that one could only bring things one carried, she wasn't about to carry anything she bought in her stomach.

When Adelle arrived Amy and Beth were the only ones home, so luckily they didn't need to sneak her inside, she found that the two of them had already charged the wands and double checked the rituals so that they felt confident that each key held two charges, they wouldn't want to end up just getting a one way ride, finding the junk on the other side would probably be tricky, but just in case Bethany had been her usual self and made a list of the ingredients just in case.

Now they only needed Mandy to show up and they could be on their way, in the meantime Adelle got to see the gate in question, that now that the wands were recharged glowed dark blue again.

“So that's the gate huh?” Adelle had said, more baffled than she let on.

“The one.” Bethany answered. “Ready to go through?”

“Yeah, though I thought I was going to have a bit to carry?” She said looking at her sister and then at the blonde friend. “You want to put on some swimwear Amy?”

“Hey! You're already wearing my bra, I'm keeping the key! So if you want someone to ride, ask your sister, or Mandy, who hasn't got a key herself.” Amy protested, not that she wasn't finding the offer intriguing, but she wasn't about to jump down someone's throat just yet. Though she did recall that woman with the rope, which made a smile come to her face uninvited and she looked Adelle over again, that mouth, down her throat and past those big things to that tiny waist. Then she remembered what had happened to Mandy and her eyes drifted lower still, finally checking out that blue jeans covered tight little rump. No, she'd walk on her own two feet.

“Al-right.” Adelle giggled turning to her sister. “So I guess I'll be using your key then.” She smiled before adding. “Do you have clothes for it? I mean I'm pretty sure that whatever you wear will get pretty wet.” She paused as she retrieved her backpack. “I guess I could carry your change of clothes in this.” She offered, not pausing for a second to think that since they were only four they could actually use the piggyback solution.

“Um...” Bethany managed, she knew she had said all this yesterday and all, but now that she was actually facing a trip into her big sister's stomach things were kind of getting to her, last night she had only really wanted to show the concept, but what she had really meant was for someone else to actually ride in there.

“So where's Mandy anyhow?” Adelle wondered while she watched Amy ready her things.

“I'll...” call her, Amy stopped herself from saying, remembering that the girl didn't have a phone any more. Luckily at that point she heard someone come in the front door. “...that should be her.”

“Ready for a ride?” Adelle asked with a grin as Mandy entered the room, quite eager to actually try this out.
1111111111111111111111111121111.title: Depart.

11111111111111111111111111211111.content:
“What?” Mandy wondered, not expecting to be jumped before she even got into the room.

“I hear you don't have a key, so that means you ride in me with my sister.” Adelle said patting her tiny belly.

“Oh...” Mandy said, she hadn't counted on that. She'd looked forward to going back, but back as in the market, not back as into some girl's gut.

“You've got clothes for it? I'm guessing it's a bit wet in there, you could change back into normal things once we get there.”

“Okay?” Mandy said, trying to make out if this was how things were going, Bethany looked as confused as she felt and Amy started motioning for the two belly stuffers to get a move-on.

“I suppose we should remove a few items...” Bethany said and before long she and Mandy found themselves in just their underwear, while Amy folded their clothes up and put them into Adelle's backpack along with Bethany's and Mandy's handbags.

“I guess there's no point in stalling.” Adelle grinned and grabbed her sister by her upper arms, pinning them to the girl's body while she quickly and with surprising ease brought the whole girl forward and her sister's head into her mouth. Bethany didn't even have time to protest, though once there she did flail her arms a bit, but as Adelle kept leaning forward, shoving Beth down her throat it wasn't too long before those arms were entirely inside and couldn't do much moving about.

Though she was kind of lost in her sister's delicious flavour and the amazing feeling of having something this big and wiggling go down her throat, Adelle knew she couldn't really pause to savour it, so she stood up with no apparent problem and brought the remainder of her sister up over her, so that gravity forced the girl down her throat. Something that worked very well and her sister slid into her mouth and down her throat in one long smooth motion, only to curl up in her stomach as a strange big lump, riding high on her belly, though the swell of it almost reached down to the rim of her pants.

“Your turn.” Adelle announced and Mandy had only time to look shocked before she too was silenced and followed Bethany down into the busty girl's stomach.

“Hmm...bigger than I thought.” Amy said as she eyed Adelle's belly that, unlike the women she'd seen eating at the market, sported quite the bulge. It had pushed her tight and luckily quite stretchy black tops up so that they crested against it, trapped between the bulge and her metal chest. It only protruded onto her front though, so the tops still clung to much of her sides and most of her back.

“Well, I'm expecting twins.” Adelle joked as she walked towards the gate, finding that the weight of the girls didn't bother her as much as she'd thought, judging by the bulge she thought that she'd walk like a pregnant woman ready to pop, but it seemed to cause her no real problems. Not even bending down and picking up her backpack and Bethany's wand seemed hard, except for her blocked vision, but she was kind of used to that with her chest, it wasn't like the belly did much of a difference in that regard.
Luckily the girls seemed smaller once inside, she had feared that she'd be having a truly huge gut, but that didn't seem the case, rather she could have passed it off as a pregnancy, if it hadn't been so lumpy.

“So are you coming?” She asked Amy who'd stood back watching the whole thing.

“Yeah, sure!” She said, pausing only to make sure she hadn't forgotten anything before following the bloated little brunette into the closet and shutting the door behind them.

“So how does this work?” Adelle wondered.

“Not really sure, but we pointed the wand at it and walked into it, like this.” Amy said and stepped out of the room in a flash of bright blue light.

On the other side she found Adelle appearing right behind her.

“Okay, now about this.” The girl said putting a hand on her bulging belly.

“Not here... come.” Amy said and motioned for Adelle to follow, she'd decided that having her cough and sputter up things inside the vendor's marketstall might not be that good an idea when they needed to be able to access the portal it contained. So she led the girl down the street a bit until she found a less busy spot. “Here... I think.”

“Hmm... fine I guess...” Adelle said, not sure standing in the open street would have been her first choice. “Got any ideas how to get them out?”
11111111111111111111111111211111.title: Ride.

111111111111111111111111112111111.content:
“Hmm...you don't think you can just cough them up?” Amy wondered. “Like you did with Beth last night?”

“I hadn't really swallowed her then, so I just spat her out actually.” Adelle explained. “You think it's possible to cough them up?”

“Yeah, we saw a performer yesterday that juggled with people, swallowing them down and shooting them back up her throat, but I guess that requires some skill, huh?”

“That sounds pretty cool.” Adelle admitted, she didn't know about the voracious tendencies in this world, it wasn't like the girls had told her much. “Though I guess it's not something a first timer like me could pull off.”

“Well in that case...” Amy said looking around, she had an idea, so she scanned the surrounding stalls, motioned for Adelle to remain where she was and then went around a corner. She still had a bit of money left, so looking around the bend she'd seen what she thought might help and went down and bought it.

“Here.” Amy said offering the end of a rope as she returned.

“Ahh... good thinking.” Adelle smiled and started stuffing the end down her neck.

“I figured, that perhaps we just needed to tickle your throat...” Amy said watching the rope go down without any reaction. “...or we could hopefully pull them out of there.”

Amy stopped Adelle. “I think that's enough.” She said leaning down to the lumpy bulge in the girl's belly addressing its occupants. “Okay girls, twist the rope around you if you can, get a good grip.”
Amy then looked to Adelle. “You try to relax and walk backwards when I start to pull. Okay?” She said and received a nod as she backed off a couple of steps to get a better angle.

Amy wired the remainder of the rope a couple of times around her waist and let the rest fall to the ground, then reached her right arm out and circled it a few times, so that the rope was twisted around it as well, giving her a solid grip. “Ready?” She asked before she started pulling, grunting as she did, feeling something give, but hardly had she started before she heard:

“Just a moment...” And felt something large on her butt and then she was rising through the air up and towards Adelle. “There ya g...”

“Stop!” Amy shouted as she found her feet about level with Adelle's mouth, but it wasn't she who had stopped who ever was behind her, but Adelle with her quite obvious body language.

“Sorry...” The voice said as Amy found her feet planted onto the ground again. She turned around to look up... at the woman who had just removed her large hand from her bottom. “...I thought you were escaping, you looked like you'd be something similar to a bound goblin in that.” The giant grey woman said indicating the rope.

Amy had a hard time determining what the woman was, but she was stocky which was just wrong for someone three meters tall and her whole frame, which wasn't covered by much, just rippled with muscles, but she didn't look anything like the typical bodybuilder. For one she didn't have pulsating veins all over and more importantly her muscles, while large, were also round and feminine, so she didn't have that angular and squarish frame, but quite curvy, but there was no denying that she looked stocky, she was just so thick.

“We were just trying to get her sister and a friend out of her stomach.” Amy said as she freed herself from the rope. “If you want to help you could pull gently on the rope.” She added when she realised that the woman had just wanted to be helpful.

“That's fine with you?” The towering woman asked Adelle, who nodded her approval.

The giantess pulled the rope in until she was holding it fairly close to Adelle's mouth, then slowly she lifted her arm up, causing the bulge to rise in Adelle's stomach and then as it continued Amy realised that Adelle was actually a couple of feet off the ground and the grey woman was just keeping her hand there, seemingly with little effort, while the two girls slowly rode up the throat until they, in a balled up lump with rope wired all around, sputtered from Adelle's mouth.

“Thank you!” Amy said, glad that this quite intimidating lady seemed so friendly.

“Don't mention it.” The giant woman smiled back and Amy could see that she didn't have human teeth, they were nice, white and all, but looked a bit pointier and she looked to have large canines, almost tusk-like.
111111111111111111111111112111111.title: Maybe...

1111111111111111111111111121111111.content:
“Wait!” Amy called as the large woman turned to leave.

“Yes?”

“Are you in a hurry?”

“No...not really, why?”

“Well, I don't even got to know your name. Heck I don't even know what you are...no offence but you don't look human, which all people we've ever met before have been...at least as far as I know.” Amy blurted.

The large woman chuckled. “Well I'm a Menúmbâh, or a city troll, a grey city troll, as you humans would say. I don't know which denomination is more degrading really. Being called a stunted human-humper by others of my kind, or being referred to as some grotesque monster by humans.”

“A troll? Well we've only heard of that in stories and well, like you say it's usually not very flattering... Never imagined a troll could look as...well, good as you.” Amy said struggling with what to say, she wasn't intending to come on to the grey lady after all.

“Thanks I guess...” The troll said, not quite sure how to take it. “How come you've only seen humans?”

“We walked through a portal and ended up here and where we come from there are only humans.”

“You sound pretty calm for someone who's blundered through a portal...”

“Well the portal didn't go away, so we've been back home and just came here again.”

“Interesting...I'm not that familiar with portals.”

“No offense, but you look a little too big, only way I see how you'd fit is if you took a ride in Adelle.” Amy said said motioning to the woman who looked at the two of them talking while helping the other two girls get dressed.

“I don't think I'd fit in her either judging by how tight your friends were.” The trollwoman said flexing her muscles a bit.

“Are all city trolls as buff as you?”

“No, I guess I'm a little over the top, most are actually pretty lanky as far as trolls go, but I guess by human standards they'd still look athletic at least.”

“So what is it you do?”

“I'm patrolling the market for criminals.” The grey woman smiled as if at a private joke.

“Oh...doesn't sound too efficient, I mean you do stand out a bit.”

“Yeah...” The troll giggled, a rather interesting phenomenon. “...but I also see over the stalls and it's not like they can outrun me, unfortunately the vendors are pretty good at taking care of trouble themselves and we don't have any repeat offenders.” She said and as on cue her belly groaned, which made Amy look at it somewhat fearfully. “Yes, like I said no repeat offenders. Unfortunately crime-rates are very low...” She said trying to calm her stomach with her hand.

“I guess I shouldn't keep you, but I'd still like your name. I'm Amy.” Amy said as the giant woman turned to leave.

“I'm Héula.” The trollwoman answered and was gone with just a few long strides.
1111111111111111111111111121111111.title: Wait!

11111111111111111111111111211111111.content:
“Thanks for handling the talking.” Adelle said. She'd been at a loss for words, even after the obstacle in her throat was removed.

“Yeah, you seemed to handle the diplomacy very well indeed.” Bethany praised, while she tried to get some more goop out of her hair and rub it off on a dry part of the rope.

“Thanks.” Amy smiled as she watched her friends. “So are you ready?” She wondered, then looked at the rope.

“I think so.” Mandy said, both her and Bethany were at least dressed again and had their bags at the ready.

“Just one thing...” Amy said and headed up to the closest stall and returned with a textile bag into which she stuffed the rope. “Not sure what to do with this, seems a bit much to carry around, but after meeting the officer I wouldn't want to be caught for littering.” She joked, but wondered partly if that was an offense.

“Give it here.” Adelle said and took the bag from Amy. “As I thought, not that heavy to me.”

Soon enough they were at the bank and this time there were several tellers, so the girls used different ones. Particularly Adelle was quite secretive about how much money she exchanged, even if she tried not to act it, though Amy wasn't any less cryptic than the day before either, with a teller each though the girls didn't know the bottom of each other's purses.

With money on their pocket and a bright sunny day ahead of them, with the sun still on the rise, the four ladies headed up to the market for some fun.
11111111111111111111111111211111111.title: On the way to the market.

choices: “We want a Daughter, we can pay.”
111111111111111111111111112111112.content:
“No, not really...” Amy said.

“You think I could just push them up and out of there with my stomach?” Adelle wondered as she held her gut with her hands.

“Worth a try. We saw a market performer do something like that, she sent the people in her stomach flying out into the air and juggled them.”

“Oh... I don't think I can do that, but as long as they get out it should, be enough right? I'm not looking for special points for fancy tricks.” Adelle smiled before looking down at her belly. “Okay girls, I hope you are ready, this could probably get a little cramped.” She said warning the two inside, then she pushed with her hands and tried to clench with her stomach in what she thought would be a helpful way.

She was rewarded with a squelching sound coming from her belly, then she felt how it shrank and how its contents felt all soft. Staring at it she saw how it shrank away and felt how her body absorbed things flowing through her gut. “Ohh...that didn't work...” She said in horror, realising that she had just digested the two girls in there.

“You have money?” Amy asked her, sounding a little anxious.

“I just digested my little sister and you ask me if I have money?” Adelle said dumbfounded while her belly reduced itself to a small potbelly.

“You digested Mandy too and she went through this yesterday.” Amy explained.

“What?”

“Here...let me show you...” Amy said retrieving her phone and on it the pictures of Mandy in the jar. “That's Mandy.”

“Really?”

“And a pig that got eaten just before her.”

“Is that the little jar that was on your desk?”

“Oh, that's where they put it? I guess, if it looked like that.”

“Not much left of her then were there?” Adelle said, looking down on her belly that had almost returned to normal proportions. “Think there'll be as little left?”

“Probably not, the girl that ate Mandy was the performer that juggled people, so I think she knew what she was doing. No offence.”

“None taken, but how do we do this then?”

“We'll need to find a jar, then find a toilet, the one the girl used to release Mandy yesterday isn't far from here. Then I suppose we need money and then we can go to the other side of town where the healers are and hopefully get them healed.” Amy said outlining the plan.

It didn't take them that long to find a jar-salesman. “How big do you think we need?” Adelle asked.

“How big do they feel? You know we only need the solid part, you can pee in the toilet.”

“Oh...” Adelle said, then tried to feel around inside her belly before opting for a jar. “I think this will do.”

She had thought they felt like a normal turd and once she had caught them in the jar and had a look she found out that she had been right, just a normal looking turd, all that was left of her sister. And her friend, she corrected herself.

Meanwhile Amy had gotten the task of collecting Mandy's and Bethany's money, doubtless they'd want their money converted as well and probably wouldn't mind too much pitching in on the healing, unless they wanted to remain a turd of course.

After a visit to the bank the two girls started the long walk through the market and to the hill on the other side, there they climbed it and Amy once more found herself facing two guards outside the temple.

“What's your business?”

“We seek the aid of a Daughter of Hela.” Amy explained which got the guard's attention, so he stepped forward, lifted the lifted on the jar Adelle was carrying and had a look.

“There's a woman down the side of the wall here that I hear is skilled enough to help you with that. A red house, the only red one along the wall.” He said and stepped back to his place.
111111111111111111111111112111112.title: Not really...

1111111111111111111111111121111121.content:
Amy shakes her head and insists. "We'd rather have a Daughter handle this. We have the money."

The guard just shrugs and lets them pass. "Might be a long wait." He says as they step into the temple.

Amy raises an eyebrow to Adelle, "What do you think he meant by... oh." she mutters as they enter the temple proper. To say it was busier than the last time they were in here would be an understatement. Apparently there had been some kind of accident nearby that required quite a bit of medical expertise. Looks like some of the Novices and Acolytes were even mobilized for some of the lesser injuries.

"What do you think happened," Amy asks. Adelle just shrugs looking around for anyone free. As they search, they hear the guard at the front greet someone. Someone important by the sound of it. Turning around they see a tall, statuesque woman, dressed similarly to the Daughters running around the temple, if less impressive. Noticing Amy and Adelle, she approaches. "Is there something I may help you with?"

"Well..." Amy starts, and holds up the small jar. The Priestess's eyes light up almost immediately.

"I see. So you have a friend you wish restored?"

"Er, yes. Two of them, actually." Amy says as Adelle looks a bit annoyed.

The Priestess nods, "Ah, yes. They can be restored quite easily, although it would seem that the Daughters are somewhat busy at the moment." She looks around the temple as she says this, almost conspiratorially, the girls think before she waves them into a side room.

"The Daughters are currently busy with other matters that require their attention. However, if you like, I could do the restoration instead. That level of healing is not normally taught to Priestesses of my level, however I can assure you I have mastered it. I have already performed it on several pets thought long gone."

Adelle pulls Amy back and leans into her ear, "I'm not sure about her. Something seems a bit fishy to me."

"Well, she says she can do it. And I'm not sure these Acolytes are allowed to lie about stuff like that."

"Maybe not, but she said it's not something they learn at that level. What if she gets it wrong?"

Amy folds her arms over her chest and thinks. "Well, it's either go with her, or we can wait who knows how long for one of the Daughters to become available. And what if someone who's been digested can't be restored after a certain amount of time?"

That last remark seems to have touched a nerve with Adelle. After all, it is kind of her fault that they're in this situation. Not that she wanted to digest the two of them, of course. "I know. But what if something goes wrong..."

The Priestess clears her throat and smiles. "If you could please make your decision soon. If I'm not needed here, then I'll need to leave to help the others."

Amy sighs and looks to Adelle. "It's your call."
1111111111111111111111111121111121.title: “We want a Daughter, we can pay.”

choices: She turns around and tells the Daughter what happened.
"Fine. We'll stay quiet, but you gotta give us something else too."
11111111111111111111111111211111211.content:
The priestess's eyes flash with opportunity as Adelle gives her answer. "Excellent," she says with a wide smile. "If you two would follow me then." She sweeps her robes dramatically as she leads the two out of the room. It would seem that the Daughters are still busy with whatever had happened, so perhaps the girls had made the correct choice.

Watching one Acolyte reset a broken arm, Amy turns to the priestess, "What happened to all those people anyway?"

Without slowing down, the Priestess replies, "I am not certain. Judging by the injuries I would say there was some sort of trouble at one of the local farm. Perhaps a stampede?" Whatever the answer is, she doesn't seem the least bit interested in such a thing, which is odd for a woman of her position. Maybe not everyone who joins the Daughters of Hela does so for the same reasons?

The Priestess leads them through the temple and into a room similar to the one they used when they had Mandy revived. Once again, the door shuts of it's own accord as they enter.

Unlike the Daughter who performed the rite last time, this Priestess seems to be all business, holding out an arm for the jar, as well as a small bowl for their money. The girls are somewhat taken aback by this forwardness, but dump some of their silver into the bowl until the Priestess thinks it's enough, after which she takes the jar.

She smiles and drums her fingers on the jar for a moment, before heading over to the altar to perform the ritual. Watching the woman's behavior is causing Adelle to have some second thoughts about doing all of this, but it's rather out of her hands for now.

Placing the jar down on top of the altar, she pops it open, and raises her hands. It takes a moment, but soon, a familiar heat swirls around the room. Maybe this lady actually does know what she's doing after all? As the air dries out, Amy will notice small beads of sweat forming on the Priestess's forehead. Did that happene last time? She wonders as the mist begins to form around the Priestess.

However as the Priestess begins to manipulate the swirling mist, something seems to go wrong. The mist builds and builds until it's almost a fog pouring into the room. If she notices that something isn't right, she doesn't show it as she continues the ritual, drawing up the darkened essence from the jar and mixing it with the thick fog spinning around her. Nothing seems to happen for a moment before, finally, a light begins to build within it, forcing the girls to once again shield their eyes.

When they open their eyes, rather than the expected Mandy and Bethany on the altar in front of the Priestess, there's a strange girl sitting there holding her head. She groans loudly, as if she has a rather nasty hangover before turning around to face Amy and Adelle.

Before them is a strange girl of rather average height, long brown hair reaching to about her mid back. Slender, but with a somewhat ample chest, and strangely enough, heterochromatic eyes. "Unnnngh. What happened?" comes an unfamiliar and yet familiar voice.

Amy gapes for a moment, but Adelle realizes what happens immediately. "Wh-what the hell?! You mixed them together!" She shouts at the top of her lungs.

The Priestess suddenly looks nervously at the door and rushes over to the two girls as Manathy? Bethandy? weakly gets to her feet and tries to get her bearings. "It's ok! Nothing's wrong!" the Priestess says in a panic. "That's exactly what the spell was supposed to do! You should have said if you wanted them to be separate!"

The girls are taken aback at the woman's sheer unmitigated gall in refusing to admit her mistake. Especially when the results are... well, what happened!

"What it was supposed to do?! We told you we wanted them both back to normal, not... this!" Adelle screams as she wrenches the door back open. Grabbing Amy and Bethandy's wrist's she drags them out the door and back to the main part of the temple.

"Wait! Wait! Please don't tell anyone this happened. I'm not supposed to do that kind of magic at my skill level." Well, finally. An admission of wrongdoing! "I don't know what went wrong. I've done that so many times. Look. If you promise not to tell anyone, I'll give you all your money back, ok?" She whispers urgently. And it's a good thing she does so, as a Daughter had come into the back to find out why someone of her rank was taking these girls into that room.

Adelle breathes in deep, and looks her in the eye before responding.
11111111111111111111111111211111211.title: "Well, alright."

choices: They head back to the market.
They explore this side of town.
111111111111111111111111112111112111.content:
Adelle looked at the woman who had tricked them and finally confessed her failure, clearly she was afraid of admitting to what she'd done to her superiors and while Adelle had thought this woman imposing before she went all desperate, the woman who'd entered had a whole other air about her and stature she realised as the woman quickly approached their location. Here was her chance she thought, she couldn't deny the woman who had fooled them's offer, but what was the money back when she had gotten some abomination instead of her sister back?

Now, please be gone until you do, we do not take well to loiterers." She commands, moving on to head back to the door she had been summoned through, each step putting a fair bit of sway in her hips.

Mandy was fuming, quite maddened by the sudden loss of her friends, and with no prior knowledge of the respect this woman's presence seemed to demand, she tactlessly storms after her. "Hey! You're really just going to walk away after what you pulled? You didn't give any warning about it!" The woman stops, and turns toward Mandy, hands over her hips and carrying a none too pleasant looking expression on her face. She lets out a sigh, and with a gesture of her hands, Mandy is lifted off of the ground. The started girl dropping the undergarments from the shock, and beginning to flail about in the air. "Hey, what the heck?" Without giving response, the Daughter moves again, this time back to the altar she had used to bring Mandy back, the girl floating along behind her.

Realizing that she had just gotten into a bad situation, Mandy tries a change in attitude. "Okay, okay, I get the point! Let me down, please! I just want my friends back! I'm sorry!" She tries to plead in her helpless state, but with a gesture of a hand, the woman sends Mandy onto the altar, a force holding her spread eagle on the surface. The woman steps up close, and pauses, looking down at Mandy, quite displeased.

"L-look, I'm sorry that I... didn't listen. J-just let me go and I'll be on my way!" Mandy tries one last time, but the Daughter ignores her, simply closing her eyes and laying her palms upon the altar. The same force holding Mandy still pressing against her jaw, forcibly keeping her mouth shut.

"Dear Hela, dear Hela, I bequeath unto you a gift. One with no respect nor appreciation. May you dole out whatever just fate your wisdom sees fit." The woman chants, and upon completion, Mandy lets out a muffled squeal as she feels herself... falling, falling into some manner of portal. Unable to rotate herself, Mandy watches as the portal gains more and more distance, then finally closes altogether. After another second, she feels a shadow coming over her, followed by the sight of the inner side of a set of titanic teeth as she falls backwards into a massive mouth, soon impacting onto a soft, slimy tongue and still unable to even move her neck about to look around, she slides back, and is soon claimed by a throat, carried down through a tight, fleshy tube into a roomier chamber, one which she freefalls in for a second before splashing into fluid which fizzles all around. The girl doesn't even last a split moment before her body is dissolved by the divine digestive drive.

With Mandy dealt with, the Daughter turns back to head back to where she came, coming across the mismatched undergarments where Mandy had dropped them. "Hm, waste not, I suppose." Picking them up, she magically adjusts their size, then slips them on for herself, giggling somewhat as she feels them subtly shift on her body on their own. Once fitted, she then continues on, dooming Amy and Bethany to cling onto her curves for quite a long time to come.
111111122.title: A matter of respect.

choices: The girls decide to ask the fairy questions.
The fairy gets right to questioning the girls.
Without anything else, the fairy flutters away!
13.content:
Both Amy and Bethany observe their surroundings with wonder and awe, taking in the sights of this new world they had discovered. Bethany looks up and takes a deep breath, taking in the air, free of the modern pollutions marring their own world, although filled with myriad scents of hay and animal odors, a unique kind of smell for the three, accustomed to cities. Amy takes her look of the crowd, examining how they hustle and bustle about, listening to the chattering coming from all ends of haggling and merriment, as she gazes, she spots Mandy moving on in direction of the pigs, and swiftly, she reaches on to stop her, grasping the neck of her shirt

"Hold it there!" She calls, stopping her friend in her tracks. Mandy turns, agitated from being stopped, and waiting for a reason why, Bethany looking back, wondering much the same. "Let's not go hurrying into the unknown, now. We should get back." Amy cautions.

Mandy and Bethany cross their arms, silently staring at Amy like she's some kind of killjoy waiting for a good reason why.

"Look, we all want to go exploring, yes, but I mean, think about it. What if the portal expires? I sure don't want to be stuck on this end. We should go over the book some more to figure things out, and bring supplies, water, snacks, maybe some extra spending money." Amy reasons.

"How do you know they'll even take our money?" Mandy questions.

"Good note, I think we're fine sticking with what we have, money-wise, I mean." Bethany responds, looking up to gaze at the shining sun, then back down to the crowd. "Wouldn't want to get thirsty in the middle of that." She adds.

The three nod in agreement, and they all turn back toward the stall they came from, Amy staying behind the others to make sure nobody ends up wandering off, anyway. Wand in hand, Bethany is the first to reach the portal, passing through it, followed by Mandy, then after knowing her friends are through, Amy goes back through as well, all three girls finding themselves back in the familiar space of the closet. Though, Bethany, turned to watch Amy emerge, witnesses the arch forming the portal quickly shift into a dull gray. Curiously, she pokes her wand at it once more, producing no particular reaction.

"Hrm." Bethany groans. "Seems it's out of power, maybe?" She hypothesizes.

Mandy is the next to speak up. "But it's still there, we just need a little more stuff to recharge it?"

"Maybe." Bethany replies. "I'll try looking through the book for more info. Amy, since this is your place, why don't you go pack the snacks and such-Oh my gosh!" She suddenly outbursts, pointing towards Amy's shoulder.

Amy recoils in surprise from the sudden call out, and Mandy is the next to notice the oddity, her eyes going wide. Confused, Amy turns to look back at the portal... nothing new there, then she feels something shift on her left shoulder? A bug? Maybe, judging by Bethany's call, it must be a big one, a scary thought! On reflex, she moves her hand over to try to swat the thing off, but amazingly, her hand is stopped, her head turning afterwards to finally see what's started the other girls.

"Whooaaa, easy there! About time you all noticed!" The cheerful, feminine voice of the tiny figure sitting on Amy's shoulder calls out.

"A-a fairy?" Amy responds out of surprise, getting her look at the dainty, unclothed, light-skinned figure, which is no taller than six inches with, at her proportions, a modest, lightweight figure, no bigger than a b-cup if she were the size of a normal person. The most striking of her appearance is the clear, dragonfly-like wings protruding from her back, idly and slowly fluttering, and her hair, short, but a very vibrant green. She's especially light for even her size, considering Amy hadn't even felt her until now, yet somehow she had managed to reach out and stop the swatting hand without much effort.

"Bingo!" The fairy responds, crossing her legs and releasing Amy's hand, now that she's sure she isn't mistaken for some killer bug.
13.title: Stowaway.

131.content:
Stepping forward, Mandy's the next one to speak. "So, what's your name, then?" She asks, the energetic little being shifts on Amy's shoulder, turning to rest her back against Amy's jawline.

"What's yours?" The little woman responds without pause, crossing her arms back and resting her head upon them.

"Well, I'm Mandy." She gestures toward Bethany. "This is Bethany. And you're sitting on Amy."

"Mmhmm, call me Kytessa, then!" She responds, offering a brief wave.

There's a little moment of silence, with the girls at a loss for questions, sure, there's a lot of trivial ones coming to mind, but they figure it'd be best not the pester Kytessa with a bombardment. The fairy detects the awkward silence, and shakes her head. "Bunch of quiet ones, are you? Never seen a fairy before?"

"No, actually. We just figured out about all this just recently." Bethany responds, prompting Kytessa to giggle for a long moment.

"Oh, wow! You're a gang of newbie witches, I guess? Oh, man, are you all in for a kick." She responds.

"Well, about that." Bethany responds. "I figure you could tell us about your world a little, then?"

Kytessa giggles once more, sitting back up. "I'll tell you as much as I'd care to ask about yours! It's all about discovery and possibility, It'd spoil all the fun if you all knew what's what! You all are gonna have to just dive in and discover, like I did, and I'm gonna do here!" She makes some simple, wide gestures with her arms as she speaks.

The rather unhelpful response gets a quiet grumble out of Bethany, who opens her mouth to elaborate, but Amy beats her to the punch with her own question. "So that's why you followed us? You want to explore our world like we were doing yours?"

"Not quite, I just saw you hanging around and sensed you're quite in touch with nature. Plus you're kinda cute!" Kytessa explains.

Amy blushes slightly as a result of the compliment. "In touch with nature? I... can't say I agree, I never did much gardening or the sort."

Kytessa's wings begin to flutter with more gusto, and she takes to the air, maneuvering in front of Amy's face. "Pff, you don't have to. I'm a nature fairy!" She points out, prodding at her hair, signifying the vibrant green of it. "I sense these things, and you're prime material for being one with nature!"

Amy reflexively takes a step back in reflex of Kytessa going right up in her face. "Okay, okay, but just what do you mean, exactly?"

Kytessa crosses her arms, fluttering in place. "Think I'll show you, then!" And without further warning, the fairy leans forward, and opens her mouth. It doesn't stop there, though, Amy's eyes going wide as she steps back once more, watching Kytessa's jaws stretch open more, and more, staring into the open abyss of the fairy's gullet. "Hey, wai-" She's cut off when Kytessa juts forward, and engulfs Amy's head, somehow swallowing the girl up with much haste, Amy's body sliding headfirst into Kytessa, whose belly only bulges out to grapefruit-size, albeit distorted into the vague shape of Amy's trapped, curled up form.

Bethany and Mandy both rush forward to assist their friend, but by the time they come within reach, Amy's toes vanish between Kytessa's lips, and the fairy quickly flutters up into the upper corner of the closet, maneuvering between them to keep out of reach of the other girls as they try reaching and leaping to catch her. "Give me a moment, will you two?" Kytessa protests, the fairy's swaying gut emitting wet growling noises as it over the course of a minute, begins to smooth out, and shrink away, Kytessa's belly soon settling into the size of an egg... until she lets out a belch, which makes it settle back to flatness.

"Aaand, we're done!" She pleasantly calls out, turns to shake her cute 'lil rump at the two girls below, and squats into the air, grunting, and on cue, out comes the "naturalized" Amy, now in the form of...
131.title: One with nature.

choices: She starts searching for a way back.
1311.content:
And as Amy emerges from the fairy's tight little anus, her friends can see, but just barely, that she's been reduced to a fairy turd, proportional in size for her predator, so as it leaves Kytessa's bottom and falls to the floor they lose track of it already in the air, for it's so small it could be mistaken for a mouse dropping.

By then though they see the fairy turning her attention back to them and they forget their friend for concern of themselves.

“I know you both wanted to jump down my throat after her, but I think I'll start with you.” Kytessa giggles as she suddenly plunges towards Mandy, who instinctively brings her arms up to shield herself from the assault, only to have them being the first part of her to go down the fairy's throat.
But the fairy continues on down and over her, the girl's head, shoulders and chest quickly follows and then as the fairy starts to flutter back up again Mandy's lower body is somehow quickly dragged inside the fairy and then down into her stomach, which again bulges grapefruit sized while it begins gurgling.

Bethany hardly have time to try and come to her friend's aid after a defensive sideways manoeuvre, before she gets to see the last of Mandy sliding down the same throat Amy went down moments ago.
The fairy only watches her with a satisfied smile while she rubs her shrinking belly, so Bethany snaps out of it hand hurls herself at the door, turning and pulling the handle with all her might, but nothing seems to happen. Slowly she stops and cranes her head upwards.

There she sees the fairy, with a much smaller belly, fluttering in the air, one hand firmly against the door and the other waving a finger as she chides. “Oh no you don't.” Before Bethany finds herself looking down the same dark abyss her friends had witnessed before her.

The fairy works quickly, she can feel herself being sucked up off the floor and down this fleshy tube. The tiny woman's belly had still been bulging quite a bit, but her stomach was empty when Bethany arrived inside it, apart from a bit of trapped gasses. Mandy had already left for the green haired woman's intestines.

Kytessa looked around as her belly swelled out to what compared to her frame would qualify as immensely. She found a purchase and flew over to the metal bar crossing the length of the room along the wall, choosing a portion where the coat-hangers had been removed and seated herself upon it.

There she sat while humming some tune and caressing her quickly shrinking gut. It wasn't long before she released a girlish burp and her belly turned completely flat once more. She shifted her seat in response, so that her bottom hung out a bit over the bar behind her.

Grunting something started to emerge from her tight bottom again, this time it was Mandy, who looked indistinguishable from Amy. And hardly had Mandy left before Bethany slipped out after her and fell to the floor as well.
Now all three girls had been reduced to fairy droppings, a pretty potent form of fertilizer, perhaps not too surprising considering what went into the makings of the tiny lumps.

The fairy that had made them though looked a bit annoyed. “As good as that felt and all I thought you girls were supposed to be witches, however green.” She complained out loud in general, it wasn't like the girls could hear her anymore.
Kytessa felt cheated, she'd hoped to absorb some magical energies, but there'd hardly been any, the ones that she got, unbeknownst to her, had probably been from digesting the keys to the portal.

She looks up in surprise as she finally notices the portal fading away.

“Hey!” She protests as she shoves herself off of the metal bar and takes to her wings again, but before she even reaches the portal it is gone. “I didn't mean for THAT to happen!” She says crossing her arms over her chest is frustration. “Now this is just great...”
1311.title: ...fertilizer.

choices: "But I suppose one more wouldn't hurt!"
Look around for something different to snack on.
13112.content:
"No, no, no! Argh ..." The fairy crosses her arms and sighs mightily.

"I'm stuck here." she whines flatly. "I'm alone now, stuck in a world full of non-magical dolts! At least they're tasty ... and - and! I'm alone with them. Hmm..." she taps her lip with her index finger, flying out of the closet and over to the window.

"Maybe, just maybe, this won't be so bad. I mean, as far as alternate worlds go, I could do worse, right?"

Surveying the sunny skies outside, the fairy realizes this world isn't too dissimilar to her own. The people mingling on the sidewalks below seemed normal-looking enough, although she notices they seem to be exclusively human.

"I take it back. What a boring-looking place! I've already eaten three girls, the taste is getting a bit repetitive..."
13112.title: A Matter of Taste

choices: The girls attempt to assess the situation
Frustrated, Mandy tries to threaten Kytessa for an explanation.
Amy starts to feel a new kind of hunger.
1312.content:
Bethany and Mandy watch on as Kytessa continues to grunt, putting forth some seriously effort into Amy's exit from her body. They've both stopped their efforts of catching her, figuring that there was nothing more they could do for Amy by this point. But instead of the foul, brown mass once would expect to emerge from a creature's rear, a smooth, round, green lump emerges from the fairy's tiny anus, the matter soon dropping free, Kytessa quickly flutters down to catch it, then present it to the two girls below.

"Ta-daaaa!" She proudly announces, showing off Amy's new green, rounded form. About a centimeter and a half in diameter.

"Wh-what is it?" Bethany bites the bullet, and asks. She can wrap her head around how her friend was just swallowed and apparently digested by this tiny figure, but this is too much!

"It's Amy, silly!" Kytessa chides, fluttering towards the closet's door. "C'mon, let's go plant her!' Hoisting Amy against her with one arm, and hooking her other around the knob, she manages to turn it and push the door open by her own strength alone, and flutters around Amy's room briefly before escaping into the backyard through her window. Flabbergasted into silence, the two remaining girls pursue, although with a significant detour to make their way to the backdoor.

Upon reaching the backyard, the two pause, since Kytessa took the window, the two have lost track of the fairy's path, and such a little thing is sure to be difficult to find in the backyard, let alone if she left the property altogether! "I'll take the left half, you get the right." Mandy commands Bethany, who gives an acknowledging nod before the two begin their search, being especially thorough to check around all the plots of bare dirt. Fortunately, it takes a few moments before Bethany spots a glimmer of light coming from behind some bushes, and after making her way through them, she spots Kytessa, sat cross-legged, sprinkling some sparkling powder onto a small mound of dirt, which presumably houses Amy.

Noticing the rustling of the bushes, Kytessa turns toward Bethany and shakes her head in disappointment. "Slowpokes, waiting 'til I get all the work done before showing up!" She playfully chides, then makes a long, fluttering hop away from the dirt mound, then watch it attentively. Bethany takes a step back as well, making some distance between herself and Kytessa, she'd like to be able to react if she tries anything funny again, then calls Mandy over, who dashes to her friend's aid.

"You found her? Where is sh- oh!" Mandy speaks, pointing toward the dirt mound, bringing Bethany's attention back to it, where she notices a small, green sprout had emerged from the ground, which grows with such haste to be easily noticeable. The girls watching in silence, the sprout quickly grows into a thick stalk which coils along the ground, which soon stops as a small growth forms on the end, its appearance growing reminiscent of a pea pod as time goes on. After a couple minutes have passed, the growing pod begins to bulge, and the girls can detect some kind of movement coming from within.

"Amy?" Bethany speaks, leaning closer until Kytessa suddenly flutters into her face, hands over her hips.

"Hey! Don't think about interrupting Nature, now!" She cautions, prompting Bethany to back off, and Kytessa returns to watching the growth.

Before long, the growth seems to stop the wiggling bulge begins to take into a somewhat more humanoid shape, and confused, panicked groans can be heard from within. More than once Mandy and Bethany consider coming forward to peel open the pod, but neither want to incur Kytessa's wrath, and give her a reason to give them a tour through her digestive tract. A couple minutes pass with nothing new happening, until Kytessa breaks the silence with a cheerful announcement of "Almost done!".

Sure enough, just after she speaks, the pod begins to change color, shifting yellow and beginning to wither, and just as it turns brown, the squirming figure within manages to break it open.

"Amy?" Mandy calls out, spotting her friend emerging from the plant, but changed, definitely changed. For starters, her skin now looks much smoother and shiner than it had been before, and has taken upon a light green color, her hair, being blonde before, was now a deeper, bushier blue, with deep blue flowers budding from it. Crawling out from the pod, Amy takes one look at her own arms before her eyes go wide.

"G-green!?" She cries out in panic and confusion. In her perspective, she was trapped inside of Kytessa's churning stomach before she had passed out, and when she came to, she found herself in a less heated, smooth, yet tight prison, and now that she had broken out of it, this is what she had discovered.

"What did you do to her?" Bethany demands an explanation from Kytessa.

Kytessa doesn't answer, instead seeming to be too busy admiring Amy's new look, until a good ten seconds pass and she peeps out a simple. "What did I say about discovery, now?" Not even turning to face her, seemingly entranced by the transformed Amy.
